loans.name: Muhiba

texts.en:
Muhiba is 48 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead.  Her partner is a driver. They have one child, and they love him very much.  They live with Muhiba’s mother together in a big house.

Muhiba sells a variety of cloths. She stores her merchandise in a local market and has a lot of customers. She wants to develop business, but has not enough money for it. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy cloth for new season.

This is her first loan with Imon International organization, and she awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cloth for new season

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en: Ms. Saeeda is a 40-year-old married woman. She is the sole earner in her family and is in the business of cloth stitching. She started her business from scratch when her husband became bedridden due to illness 12 years ago. She is running her business successfully and now she wants to purchase cloth of different colors for ready-made garments. Due to her past good experience with a loan from the Kashf Foundation, she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). This loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase cloth of different colors for ready-made garments.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Mrs. Robina is a 40-year-old widow. She started her own business after her husband's death. She set up a general store in her house by taking a loan from the Kashf Foundation. She sells daily use goods to her community. Her son also plays a supportive role. He is a rickshaw driver. 

Being a single parent of five children she took this initiative to give her children a better future. She is responsible for their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. She has applied for a repeat loan of 40,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to purchase more items including bread, eggs, butter, milk, cold drinks, shampoo, cleaning products etc. She hopes to have a good experience with this loan.

loans.use: To purchase more items including bread, eggs, butter, milk, cold drinks, shampoo, cleaning products etc.

loans.name: Celso Rogoberto

texts.es:
CELSO TIENE 59 AÑOS DE EDAD ES SOLTERO VIVE CON LOS PADRES NO TIENE HIJOS VIVE EN CHIMBO

EL SE DEDICA A  LA ZAPATERIA PERO EL DINERO DEL CREDITO NECESITA PARA LA COMPRA DE BIENES DE CONSUMO EL CREDITO LE AYUDADO HA CONPRAR LO QUE NECESITA EN EFECTIVO.

EL SUEÑO DE CELSO ES TENER DINERO PARA COMPRAR UNA CASA PROPIA.

EN LOS TIEMPOS LIBRES LE GUSTA SALIR CON LOS AMIGOS A CONVERSAR.
texts.en:
Celso is 59 years old and is single with no children. He lives with his parents in Chimbo. He makes a living with a shoe store but he needs the loan money for personal consumption. In the past the loans have helped him buy what he needs. 

Celso´s dream is to have money to buy his own house. In his free time he likes to go out with his friends to talk.

loans.use: to buy goods.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is married with two kids. She is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. Cristina is a farmer, and she operates a gardening business to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years, and every month she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Cristina became a member of GDMPC in 2011. In the future, Cristina hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, vive con su familia, su esposa y sus hijos, él es agricultor, realizando los trabajos desde muy joven ya que su padre se lo inculcó, no tiene un horario establecido para atender los trabajos de la tierra.

Solicita un préstamo porque está iniciando la siembra de la temporada de verano, para esto necesita comprarse el abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, que son necesarios y que le permite tener una producción sana de plagas, este crédito le dara lo necesario para que continúe trabajando la agricultura.

El objetivo de Miguel es tener buenas cosechas en sus tierras, ya que ésto le permitirá comercializarlas para generar ingresos a sus hijos, ofreciéndoles un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel lives with his family-his wife and children. He is a farmer and has been doing this work since he was very young because his father taught him. He does not have a set schedule to attend to his agricultural duties. 

He is requesting a loan because he is beginning the summer planting season. For this he needs to buy fertilizer, insecticide and pesticide, which are necessary and allow him to have a healthy harvest free of plagues. This loan will give him what is necessary to continue working in agriculture. 

Miguel´s goal is to have good harvestso on his land because this will allow him to sell them and generate income for his children, offering them a better quality life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide and pesticide.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is widowed with five children, and only one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren and a brother). 

She operates a retail shop selling used clothes and has been in this business for two years. She works six days a week. She also gets additional income from houses for rent and a bar. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of used clothes. She works in a shop and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to build rental houses. 

She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and electricity bills.

loans.use: To more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Martin Beranio

texts.es:
Martin Beranio tiene 65 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, vive con la esposa y los hijos de 41, 38, 37 y 34 años de edad en ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Martin Beranio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, además se dedica a la cría de animales cómo gallinas, cerdos. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas de maíz, abonos, urea, líquidos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá seguir trabajando y obtener ingresos para el bienestar de la familia.

El sueño es seguir trabajando y crecer en las siembras. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte, escuchar música y disfrutar de las fistas del recinto..
texts.en:
Martin Beranio is 65 years old and is married with four children. He lives with his wife and their children who are 41, 38, 37 and 34 years old in Ventanas, in the Los Rios province. 

He is a member of VRC La Union which is located in Recinto Aguas Frias which is located in the Ventanas canton. This man from Ventanilla makes a living in agriculture with short cycle crops such as corn, rice and beans. In addition he raises animals including chickens and pigs. He buys and sells in Ventanas. 

He is requesting the loan to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, urea and liquids. With the help of the loan he will be able to continue working and obtain income for the well being of his family. 

His dream is to continue working and grow his harvests. In his free time he likes to play sports, listen to music and enjoy the local parties.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizer, urea and liquids.

loans.name: Yensi

texts.es:
Yency  es una joven de 23  años de edad, ella vive con sus padres y 4 hermanos, tres de los cuales son menores de edad, en la comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus hermosas playas  y la gran variedad de vida silvestre, las principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Yency  tiene un taller de ebanistería y lo trabaja junto con su hermano mayor , ellos fabrican muebles  para el hogar, los cuales han sido bastante acogidos por la comunidad y quieren extender su clientela a otros localidades.

Yency está solicitando un crédito de setecientos mil colones (¢700.000) para comprar una máquina lijadora , madera y otros materiales para seguir adelante con el proyecto de ebanistería

Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo  espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede alcanzar mayores metas.
texts.en:
Yancy is a 23-year-old young person. She lives with her parents and four siblings, three who are minors, in a community called Osa, located in Caña Blanca, in the province of Puntarenas. This community is a much-visited rural area known for its beautiful beaches and wildlife. The main economic activities here are tourism and agriculture. Yency has a furniture-making workshop. She works here with her older brother. They make furniture for the home. Their furniture is popular in the community. They would like to expand their customer base to include other communities. 
Yency is asking for a loan of seven hundred colones (c700,000) to be used to buy light manufacturing equipment, wood and other materials needed to continue with their furniture making business.
Yency is a member of the Communal Credit Business of Caña Blanca, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. With this loan she would like to improve her personal and economic situation. Also, thanks to the organization and the ease of obtaining credit, she is able to reach new goals.

loans.use: to buy light manufacturing equipment and basic materials for her furniture-making business

loans.name: Jose Benjasmin

texts.es:
Jose, es agricultor vive con su esposa y su hijo, solo él trabaja en su familia para velar por los gastos más necesarios, aprendió la agricultura por su padre quien siempre se ha dedicado a esta actividad, no tiene una horario  para realizar su trabajo.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como el abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, que son los necesarios para prevenir las plagas en los cultivos, este préstamo le permitirá tener todo necesario para que sus siembras crezcan sanas y recibir una buena cosecha.

El objetivo de él es mejorar sus cosechas de granos básicos, ya que esto le permitirá ser más rentable en sus ventas y poder crecer económicamente con su familia, dentro de sus metas esta comprarse su propia casa y velar por las necesidades de su hijo.
texts.en:
Jose is a farmer. He lives with his wife and son. He is the only one working in his family to take care of the most necessary expenses. He learned farming from his father, who has always done this activity. He has no set schedule to do his work.

He is asking for a losn to buy agricultural materials such as fertilizer and herbicides, These are necessary to prevent pests on the crops. The loan will allow him to have everything he needs so that his crops can be healthy and he can have a good harvest.

His objective is to improve his harvests of basic grains, since this will make his profits grow and he can grow financially with his family. Among his goals are buying his own house and taking care of his son's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbs and pesticides.

loans.name: Herlinton Manuel

texts.es: Herlinto Manuel, soltero con 2 hijos menores de edad, su actividad econominca es el servicio de trasnporte, desde hace 3 años que tiene dicha actividad, dicha actividad lo inicio como un proyecto, ya que   su esposa trabajaba para una empresa y surgio la idea de brindar el servicio de trasporte a los trabajodores de dicho lugar ya que hace turno de dia y de noche, los financiamientos le han servidos de mucha de ayudar para invertir en  mantenimiento de su vehiculo ya que de dicha forma le ayuda a dar un buen servicios a sus clientes, del financimiento comprara repuestos como llantas nuevas
texts.en: Herlinto Manuel is single with two young children. For the past three years he has worked in transportation. He first began this work as his wife worked for a company and she suggested that he provide transportation to the employees of her company, as there is both a day and a night shift there. These loans have been a great assistance with maintaining his vehicle. This allows him to provide good services for his customers. With this loan he will buy parts such as new tires.

loans.use: to buy parts such as new tires.

loans.name: Duo Amor De Los Amores Group

texts.es: Dúo Amor de los amores , este dúo está integrado por teresa es originaria de tecpan, tiene 45 años de edad tiene 5 hijos que todavía son menores de edad, y necesitan del cuido de ella, se dedica a la compra y venta de laurel, y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la crianza de animales, está luchando sola ya que su esposo murió hace un año entonces ella le ha tocado luchar muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de laurel, y para la compra de animalitos(pollos) para la crianza y cundo ya estén grandes venderlos a un mejor precio. El sueño de ella es ampliar su negocio de venta de laurel, y poder sacar adelante y darles lo mejor a sus hijos, ella ya trabajo con un crédito Kiva y fue puntual en sus pagos. Espera que nuevamente la puedan ayudar.
texts.en:
The Dúo Amor de los Amores includes Teresa who is a native of Tecpan. She is 45 years old and has five children that are still of dependent age and require her care. She buys and sells laurel and as a secondary job she raises animals. She is fighting on her own because her husband died a year ago. Because of this she has had to fight very hard to move her family forward. 

She is requesting this loan to buy laurel and to buy small animals (chickens) to raise and once they are larger to sell them at a better price. Her dream is to expand her business selling laurel and move her children forward and give them the best she can. She has already worked with Kiva and was punctual in her payments. She hopes to receive help again.

loans.use: to buy laurel and purchase animals (chickens) to raise.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.es: Marjorie de 37 años de edad casado, tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, Marjorie ya ha tenido créditos, en los años anteriores, la cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad, el financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar productos para ofrecer a su clientela como: pantalones, short, camisas, faldas, jugos de sabanas, zapatos, pillamas, edredones, entre otros, esto ha sido posible con la ayuda que fundación león 2000 y el programa kiva le bridan a los pequeños comerciante. Marjorie tiene sueños y metas en un futuro poder establecer una tienda en lugar fijo, ya que sus pedidos los distribuye de forma ambulante.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 37 years old and married. She works selling general merchandise and has had loans previously. In earlier years she has proven her responsiblity. She would like this loan to invest in working capital and buy products to offer to her clientele including pants, shorts, shirts, skirts, sheet sets, shoes, pajamas, quilts and other items. 

This has been possible with the help of Fundacion Leon 2000 and Kiva´s program which are brought to small scale business owners. Marjorie has dreams and goals for the future to establish a store in a set place because she distributes her customers´ requests by traveling.

loans.use: to buy pants, shorts, shirts, skirts, sheet sets, shoes, pajamas, quilts and other items.

loans.name: Los Conquistadores Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Los Conquistadores” está conformado por 19 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; artesanía en madera, bazar, costuras, almacén, venta de pan amasado, chocolatería, feriantes, venta de herramientas, venta de completos, abarrotes, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Recoleta, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Johana, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie al fondo del grupo, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, lleva puesto una polera de color celeste, su cabello lo usa tomado y es de color castaño oscuro.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de masas y frituras, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que se desempeña desde su casa vendiendo a las empresas que se ubican frente de su hogar, trabaja de lunes a sábado y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en la vega central (mercado de alimentos y frutas al por mayor y menor) a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará un fogón y mercadería como masas, aceites, bolsas, servilletas, ají, mostaza, mayonesa, kétchup, aceite y queso.
Una de las metas de Johana es tener un local donde venda abarrotes y a la vez continuar con su negocio de frituras, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de  vida.
Johana vive junto a su  marido y sus 2 hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal es tener su casa propia ya que por ahora vive en la casa de sus padres, y desea tener su privacidad con su familia.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Recoleta es una de las 34 comunas de Santiago (capital de Chile) y se encuentra ubicada en el sector centro-norte del Santiago, región metropolitana. Cuenta con un activo comercio, destacando el barrio comercial de Patronato que ha acogido principalmente a comerciantes árabes (en un principio) y coreanos (en la actualidad).
texts.en:
This communal bank “Los Conquistadores” [The Conquerers] comprises 19 entrepreneurs dedicated to different professions including: making wood handicrafts; running a stall or grocery store; dressmaking; selling dough; making chocolates; selling tools and parts, and other services. All the members live in the community of Recoleta, located in the city of Santiago.

Johana, president of the communal bank, is seen in the photo in the second position from left to right in the front row, wearing a blue polo with her brown hair worn down. For the past year, she has been selling dough and fried pastries. She makes the products at her home and sells them to businesses located nearby. She works Monday to Saturday on a flexible schedule.

She purchases needed merchandise and supplies in the central market (wholesale and retail fruit and foods market) at low cost to generate higher profits. With the loan, she will buy a stove and supplies such as dough, oil, bags, napkins, garlic, mustard, mayonaise, ketchup, and cheese. One of Johana's goals is to have a local grocery store and continue to sell her fried pastries so that she can earn more income and have a better life. Johana lives with her husband and two children ages 13 and 4. Her personal dream is to have her own home because she now lives in her parents'  home and would like to have more privacy for her family.

She is happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, since it allow her to invest in her business. She says that training has been crucial for her business and personal development, and she has learned to organize, spend her income, and invest better..Recoleta is one of 34 communities in Santiago (the capital of Chile) and is located in the central north section of the Santiago metropolitan area. It has a lively business section, including the Patronato area, which at first was home to many Arab business people and now has many Korean business owners.

loans.use: to buy a stove and supplies such as dough, oil, bags, napkins, garlic, mustard, mayonaise, ketchup, and cheese.

loans.name: Jessica Karina

texts.es: Jessica, de 36 años, es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos y vive en el municipio de Morazan, Yoro. Hace 6 años que  Jessica se dedica  a la venta de comidas por encargo, pollo con tajadas, carne asada, y otras que  le pidan, y  ropa nueva y usada, de manera ambulante. Para mantener su negocio activo a invertido varios prestamos con ODEF y ahora solicita otro de 26,000 Lempiras, siendo ya el numero 12. Con este préstamo va comprar materiales para construir la caseta de madera para el negocio pegado a su casa, para dar un mejor servicio al cliente y con una parte va comprar insumos para la elaboración de comidas y compra de ropa para vender. Ella espera seguir creciendo en su negocio ya que su meta es apoyar a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Jessica, age 36, is a single mother with three children.  She lives in the municipality of Morazan, Yoro.  

Jessica has been selling food by order for six years.  She sells chicken with fried plantains, roasted meat, and other foods by request.  She also sells new and used clothes in an itinerant manner.  In order to keep her business active, she has invested various loans from ODEF.

She is now requesting another loan for 26,000 lempiras, which will be her 12th loan.  She will use this loan to buy materials to build the business stand attached to her house from wood.  She will do this to give her customers better service.  She will use part of the loan to buy supplies to make food and clothes to sell.

She hopes to continue growing in her business because her goal is to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy materials like zinc sheeting, wood, and cement to build a business stand attached to her house, to buy supplies for making food, and to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Afra Elodia

texts.es:
La señora Afra, es socia del banco comunal “Las Pomarrosas”. Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 64 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos.
Fundadora de este banco comunal que aún es nuevo recién llevan dos años trabajando y es un banco muy sólido que cada vez están trayendo más socias a integrarse, se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches, lo hace en la vereda de su casa.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 juegos de mesa de plástico, 25 kilos de azúcar, 25 kilos de arroz para preparar los juanes para dar más comodidad a sus clientes, los días que más clientes tiene son a inicios de semana ahí es cuando necesita las mesas.
A la edad que tiene sigue con ganas de seguir trabajando para poder tener su dinero y no depender de sus hijos que ya son mayores y tiene su familia cada uno, quiere seguir trabajando con Manuela Ramos porque se siente muy a gusto en su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Afra is a member of the “Coronel Portillo district, Departament of Ucayali. She is 64 years old and a widowed mother of four children. 

She is a founder of this communal bank which is still new. It has been functioning for two years and is a very solid bank. They are always bringing in more members. She sells food in the evenings from the sidewalk in front of her house. 

With her new loan of S/. 1,200.00 nuevos soles, she will buy 2 sets of plastic tables, 25 kilos of sugar, and 25 kilos of rice to make the juanes. This will make her customers more comfortable. The days she has the most customers are the beginnings of the week and that is when she needs the tables.  

At her age she still wants to work to be able to have her money and not depend on her children, who are grown and have their own families. She wants to keep working with Manuela Ramos, because hs feels very happy in her communal bank.

loans.use: to buy tables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth, es socia del banco comunal “Las Pomarrosas”, del Distrito Coronel Portillo, Departamento dDe Ucayali, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.
Es una de las fundadoras de este banco comunal,  se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza  por catálogo negocio que le está yendo bien cada vez tiene más clientes porque los productos que vende son accesibles al público.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/ 1,500.00 nuevos soles comprará más productos para tener en su vitrina y ofrecer a sus clientes más variedad de productos: 6 perfumes para hombres, 4 cremas para el cabello, 2 cremas para el cuerpo, 3 perfumes para damas, 2 champús para niños
Tiene dos hijas pequeñas que atender y con la ayuda de su hija mayor pueden salir hacer la entrega y cobranza de sus productos  con la movilidad que tiene, gracias a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos que hasta ahora le han otorgado, para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Communal Bank ¨Las Pomarrosas¨ in the Coronel Portillo distrist in the Department of Ucayali. She is 45 years old and is married with three children.

She is one of the Communal Bank´s founders. She makes a living selling beauty products via catalogs. This business has been going well, she always has more customers because the products she sells are accessible to the public.

With her new loan of 1,500 nuevos soles she will buy more products to have at her window and offer her customers a greater variety of products: six men´s colognes, four hair creams, two body creams, three women´s perfumes and two children´s shampoos. 

She has two small daughter to whom she cares for. With the help of her older daughter they go out to deliver her products with ease. She is thankful for Manuela Ramos for the loans that they have provided her to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria de 65 años de edad , viuda, con siete hijos todos independientes,  tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, también vende mercadería en general , y cuenta  con los ingresos de un taxi que era de su esposo el cual hoy en día ella lo administra, Hilaria siempre ha sido trabajadora responsable, en la actualidad su clientes ha crecido y su demanda también  por lo tanto esta solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo , con el financiamiento comprara productos de consumo diario como: arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijoles, sal, pan, huevos, queso, cuajada, entre otros. Sus sueños y metas son seguir trabajando hasta donde su salud se lo permita y de dicha ahorrar para el futuro y tener una fuente de ingresos el día de mañana y no depender de nadie.
texts.en: Hilaria is 65 years old widow with seven children who are independent. She has a grocery store where sells general merchandise. In addition she has an investment in a taxi that belonged to her husband. She still manages this business. Hilaria is a responsible worker. That is why her customer base has grown and with it their needs. She is asking for a loan for working capital. With this loan she will buy basic grocery items such as rice, oil, sugar, beans, salt, bread, eggs and cheese as well as other items. Her dreams and goals are to continue working as long as her health permits, save for the future and have resources for the future and to not be dependent on anyone.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, beans, salt, bread, eggs, cheese and other grocery items.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is a 24-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 5 years. She describes herself to be an honest woman. She operates a retail store where she sells drinks. She has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. Her business is located within a densely populated area, and her primary customers are residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more soft drinks to resell. Her business goal is to venture into a new business of a restaurant within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have expanded her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Banco Fe Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “ Banco Fe” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; kioscos, feriantes, venta de ropa,  confección de uniformes escolares, venta de pan amasado, venta de huevos, artesanía, venta de chocolates, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes al comuna de Quilicura, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Maria, delegada del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una chaqueta de color lila, en sus manos sostiene una carpeta de Fondo Esperanza, su cabello es de color claro y lo usa corto.
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva surtida, se desempeña en su rubro desde hace 7 meses. Comenta que trabaja de puerta en puerta los días lunes, martes, jueves y viernes, y los días miércoles, sábado y domingo se ubica en un puesto en la feria, su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad, ya que tiene a su cuidado su nieta pequeña.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en distribuidoras y locales donde encuentra la ropa a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará toalla, sabanas, paño de cocina, calcetas de polar (tela abrigadora), camisetas.
Una de las metas de Maria es surgir como microempresaria, tener un negocio bien surtido para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Maria vive junto a sus 2 hijos de 15 y 10 años de edad y una nieta de 5 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es tener una buena situación para darles un buen pasar a sus hijos y nieta, y a nivel laboral es seguir trabajando para comprar más mercadería y poder tener un puesto estable en la feria.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Quilicura es una comuna perteneciente a Santiago, capital de Chile, ubicada en el extremo noroeste de región metropolitana. El origen del nombre de la comuna viene del mapudungun (lengua mapuche): "kila", que significa “tres” y "kura" que significa “piedra”, por lo que se deduce que el nombre de Quilicura equivale a "tres piedras", como  el nombre que le dieron los primeros habitantes de este valle en referencia a los tres cerros que son perfectamente visibles y que delimitan la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Banco Fe”. It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who work in different areas. Among these are kiosks, market sellers, clothes sellers, making school uniforms, selling bread, selling eggs, selling artisanal crafts, selling chocolates, service providers and more. All of them belong to the Quilicura community, located in the city of Santiago.

Maria is a delegate of the communal bank. In the photo she is seated in the first row first from the left. he is wearing a light purple jacket and in her hands is a Fondo Esperanza file. Her hair is light colored and she wears it short.

She sells new clothing. She has been doing this for 7 months. She says that she works door to door on Mondays, Tuesdays, Thurdays and Fridays. On Wednesdays, Saturdays and Sundays she has a locale at the market. She sets her schedule according to availablilty, since she has to care for her little granddaughter. 

She buys the merchandise she needs from distributors and locales where there is low cost clothing so that it is financially convneient. With the loan, she will buy towels, sheets, kitchen cloths, sweat socks (of warm fabric), and t-shirts. 

One of Maria's goals is to grow as a micro-businesswoman. She has a well stocked business to make more income and thus have a better quality of life. Maria lives with her 2 children, aged 15 and 10 and a 5 year old granddaughter. Her dreams for her family are to have a good situation to give a good life to her children and her granddaughter. Her work goals are to keep working to buy more merchandise and be able to have a stable locale at the market.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity offered by the Fondo Esperanza, since it will allow her to invest in her business. She remarks that the trainings have been fundamental for her business and also for her personal development. She has learned to organize and distribute her income and investments in a better way. 

Quilicura is a community that belongs to Santiago, the capital of Chile, located in the extreme northeast of the metropolitan region. The origin of the community's name comes from Mapudungun (the Mapuche language). "Kila", means "three" and "kura" means “rock”. From this is can be deduced that the name Quilicura means "three rocks", the name given by the first inhabitants of this valley, referring to the three perfectly vivisble mountains that surround the community.

loans.use: to buy towels, sheets, kitchen cloths, sweat socks (made of warm fabric) and t-shirts.

loans.name: Leopoldo Antonio

texts.es:
Leopoldo, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, vive con su esposa, trabaja en el cultivo de maíz y la crianza de ganado, trabaja en lo propio y también paga la mano de obra para qué le ayude a realizar las labores, de estas actividades logra mantener a su familia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de los insumos, que serán aplicados a la siembra que está realizando en este período, su compra sera el abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, que le ayudan a fortalecer la producción de granos básicos eliminando las plagas, espera a través de este préstamo poder mejorar su capacidad y trabajar más el terreno.

Su aspiración es mejorar económicamente con su familia, mejorar la producción de granos básicos y continuar con la fuerza de trabajo.
texts.en:
Leopoldo is a farmer and rancher. He lives with his wife. He grows corn and raises cattle. He works independently and also pays for workers to help him complete his work. With these activities he is able to support his family
He is asking for this loan in order to buy agricultural products for his crops.  This is the time of year to buy these items. He will buy fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides, which will stabilize the production of his grains by eliminating diseases. He hopes it will also increase his crop production and help him make optimal use of the land. His dream is to improve the economic situation of his family, improve his grain production and continue working.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and insecticides.

loans.name: Kellen

texts.en:
Kellen is a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. She is a widow with five adult children and has twenty years in active farming with milk, maize and fruits being her main produce. She runs her farm with the help of one farmhand. 

Kellen has requested a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. She says more income year round from the non-seasonal poultry business will help her improve the family's living standards. She is also focusing on buying more parcels of land. 

Kellen says rampant crop failure and inadequate rains have informed her decision to start poultry farming so as to secure her future.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Sayram

texts.en:
Sayram is 49 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband works at the Ministry of Melioration and he has a small salary. That's why Sayram decided to organize her own business. She sells food items in a shop. She has had this business for more than two years. Her elder son helps her with it. She wants to develop her business further but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy. 

This is the first loan she has requested from a microlending organization and she awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy food items for increasing the assortment at her store

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a mother of four children aged between 2 and 22 years. She lives with her family in their rural home in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya, where she carries out farming, with milk, maize and bananas being her major produce for the local market.

Lucy has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds and dairy goats. She says she will be able to diversify her farming business with the loan capital and generate enough income to meet her family's basic needs. Her aspiration is to produce enough and supply external markets with better prices for such products.

Lucy laments occasional crop failure as the main challenge she faces.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds and dairy goats.

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
Aged 50 and originally from the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Sam is a widowed mother of five children. Out of her five children, three children need her support as they are still in school. 

For her children's sake, she earns a daily income from a five-hectare plot of crop-planting farmland. She manages to earn about 21,000 KHR per day from the business that she has been with for ten years. 

The main challenge for her business is the shortage of water supply for her paddy field. To overcome this challenge, she leads a group of two female members to seek a new loan; both of them are the sixth-time borrowers. After her successful past loans that she completely paid back, she believes that she can keep up a good living standard for her family. 

With this new loan, she is seeking 1,000,000 KHR, whilst her co-member is applying for 700,000 KHR. She, as the leader, will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, gasoline for pumping water, insecticide for spraying, and to pay for labor costs for her farmland. She hopes to grow her rice in a timely manner and sell it at a good price, so she can make more income for her children's sake.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and gasoline for pumping water, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Haydee Francisca

texts.es: Haydee Francisca, esta emprendedora, es una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora, tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos lácteos como cuajada, queso, venta de leche de vaca, lo cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación negocio que surgió hace varios años c en el objetivo de tener una herramienta de trabajo para poder sobrevivir y tener un medio digno de vida. Su objetivos es seguir luchando hasta donde Dios le de vida.
texts.en: Haydee Francisca is enterprising. She is a responsible, hardworking woman. She sells milk products such as yogurt, cheese, and cow’s milk. Her business is located in her home. She has been doing this work for many years. Her goal is to have a work related machine in order to progress and have a dignified life. Her objective is to continue working as long as God gives her life.

loans.use: to buy yogurt, cheese and sell milk products.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a father and a farmer in his rural home area of Nkubu. He has been in active farming for six years, with his farm producing milk, bananas, and vegetables. This helps in meeting his family’s basic needs. He is also a charcoal dealer.

James has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to meet the cost of constructing a zero grazing unit (stall-feeding in order to make better use of limited land area, feed, and organic resources) within his farm and improve his dairy farming business. He says the income will help him meet the family’s basic needs and more particularly, the education of the children.

He, however, points out that poor infrastructure and low prices in the local market for the farm produce remain the main challenges.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch is a resident from Kampong Cham province's Dambae district, Cambodia. She is a 55-year-old married mother with four children. 

To earn a daily decent income, she plants rubber tree seedlings to resell. It is the business that she has been with for three years. She is able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day. 

Touch took her first loan with VisionFund in 2011 and paid back the entire loan with success. The past loan has helped her to better support her household. 

Now she is seeking a new loan in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR. She will use her loan to buy more rubber tree seedlings and to pay for the labor costs. She hopes to grow her seedlings healthily, so she can make more income.

loans.use: to buy more rubber tree seedlings and to pay for the labor costs.

loans.name: Liliana Del Rocio

texts.es:
LILIANA TIENE 21 AÑOS ES CASADA TIENE 2 HIJOS VIVE CON EL ESPOSO Y CON LOS HIJOS EN CHIMBO.

SE DEDICA A LA CRIA DE ANIMALES DE CERDOS Y GALLINAS PARA LUEGO VENDERLOS YA QUE ES SU UNICA FUENTE DE INFRESO, EL DINERO LE AYUDADO HA COMPRAR MAS AMILMALES Y COMIDAD PARA ELLOS.

LILIANA SUEÑA CON TRABAJAR PARA TENER UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA.

EN LOS TIERMPOS LIBRES LE AYUDA EN LAS TAREAS ESCOLAR.
texts.en:
Liliana is twenty-one years old and married with two children. She lives with her husband and children in Chimbo.

She makes her living raising and selling animals such as pigs and chickens. Since this is her only form of income, the money has helped her to buy more animals as well as food for them.

Liliana dreams of working to have a better quality of life.

In her free time she helps her children with their homework.

loans.use: to buy animals such as chickens and pigs

loans.name: Sanh's Group

texts.en:
Sanh is 50 years old and a villager from a rural area of Sa Ang district, Cambodia. She and her husband are rice farmers on two hectares of farmland. Additionally, she raises pigs at home while her husband catches fish for sale.

The entire income generating activities earn them about 19,000 Riel (KHR) which support her five children. Two of her children are students, while the others work at a factory but receive a low salary. She has had this business for 29 years and is challenged with the lack of working capital for it. 

Sanh's group is composed of four members: three women and one man. She and one of her co-members are on their second loans, whereas the remaining two group members are on their seventh loans with Kiva's partner VisionFund. The past loan helped her to manage her household's daily basic needs and to set aside some money to buy pigs for raising as extra income. She's now leading her group for this new loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay plowing and harrowing fees. She will also use a some of it to buy three more pigs to raise. She expects to gain more yield during this rainy season so as to double her income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed, and to pay harvesting and harrowing fees

loans.name: Rolbin

texts.es:
Rolbin es un joven de 33 años de edad, casado, tiene tres hijos  pequeños, con un único ingreso familiar que es el suyo,   vive con su esposa  e hijos, en una comunidad  llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal , en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus bellas playas y la diversidad de fauna y flora que posee .Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Rolbin está urgido de comprar una motocicleta para trasladarse al trabajo ya que vive a varios kilómetros del mismo, además manifiesta que los fines de semana usará la motocicleta para prestar sus servicios a restaurantes locales entregando comidas rápidas a domicilio, de esta manera obtendrá un dinero extra para los gastos del hogar.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita  Rolbin es un micro crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000), para comprar la motocicleta que le están ofreciendo y poder lograr su objetivo.

El  es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo  espera mejorar en parte su situación económica.
texts.en:
Rolbin is thirty-three years old and married with three little children. He is the family's only source of income. He lives with his wife and children in a community called Osa, located in Caña Blancal, in the province of Puntareñas. This community is noted for being an often-visited rural area because of its beautiful beaches and the diversity of its fauna and flora. Tourism and agriculture are the principal economic activities.

Rolbin is in urgent need of a motorcycle to transport himself to work since he lives many kilometers from where he works. Moreover, he affirms that he will use the motorcycle on the weekends, loaning his services to local restaurants to deliver fast food to the home. In this way he will earn a little extra money for home expenses.

Rolbin is currently requesting a micro loan of one million colones (¢1.000.000) to buy the motorcycle that they are offering him and to be able to achieve his goal.

He is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, one of the 110 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. With this loan he hopes to improve in part his economic situation.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Deisy Lorena

texts.es:
Deisy, tiene cuatro hijos, vive junto a su esposo, se dedica a la venta de sorbetes, tiene seis años en este negocio que lo inició junto con su esposo, el realizar la venta de manera ambulante mientras que ella atiende a los clientes desde su vivienda.

Solicita un préstamo para abastecer el negocio comprando según la variedad de paletas y sorbetes de muchos sabores, esto le ayudará a mejorar la clientela ya que al diversificar los productos, estará atendiendo mejor los justos de cada quien, mejorando el servicio y también sus ingresos.

Su objetivo es sacar adelante a sus hijos, que ellos se puedan superar a través del estudio para tener mejores oportunidades en el futuro.
texts.en:
Deisy has four children and lives with her husband. She sells ice cream. She started this business six years ago with her husband. He is a roving salesperson while she sells the ice cream from their home. She is asking for this loan in order to supply their business. They will buy a variety of popsicles and many flavors of ice cream. Having a greater variety of products will increase their customer base and also their earnings. 
Her objective is to help her children succeed in their studies so they can have better opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy popsicles and various flavors of ice cream.

loans.name: Fayzaly

texts.en:
Fayzaly is 27 years old. He is not married yet. Fayzaly lives with his parents. His parents love him very much. 

He has worked at the Tajik Standard for more than two years as a leading specialist. He is one of the best workers and his colleagues know him as smart and hardworking. 

He wants to buy a new television as his television is broken. This loan will help him to provide his family with news and entertainment. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Imelda Pastora

texts.es: Imelda, casada de 53 años de edad con tres hijos,tiene por actividad economica una librería, el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion, donde ofrece todo articulos escolares, cuadernos universitarios, cuaderno a rayas, cuadernos doble rayas, cuadernos universitarios, lapiceros, engrapadadoras, gracias al apoyo que fundacion leon 2000 le ha brindado es que ha podido sarlir adelante con su negocio.
texts.en: Imelda is 53 years old, married,  and has three children. She owns a bookstore, which is based in a room in her house. Here she offers all school supplies, college notebooks, lined notebooks, double lined notebooks, pens, and staplers. Thanks to the support that Fundación Leon 2000 has offered her,  she has been able to get ahead with her business.

loans.use: to purchase college notebooks, lined notebooks, double-lined notebooks, pens, and staplers.

loans.name: Lesbia Elena

texts.es: Lesbia Elena de 46 años de edad, con 6 hijos de los cuales 4 son menores de edad y depende económicamente de ella, Lesbia tiene por actividad la el servicio de costura a sus clientes fijos y eventuales y está ubicado en su casa de habitación   la cual consiste( elaboración de prenda de vestir como vestidos de primera comunión, vestidos de quince años, faldas,  pantalones, camisas, short), Lesbia manifiesta que el crédito ha sido de gran utilidad para poder darle respuesta a los clientes los cuales le tenía trabajos pendientes ,y por lo tanto ha podido mantener la estabilidad de su negocio  y su hogar en la parte económica
texts.en: Lesbia Elena is forty-six years old with six children of whom four are underage and economically dependent. Lesbia makes her living sewing clothing for regular and occasional clients. Her business is in her home. Her services consist in making articles of clothing such as first communion and quinceañera dresses, as well as skirts, pants, shirts, and shorts. Lesbia says that the loan has been a great help in that it permitted her to respond to clients for whom she had work pending, which has enabled her to maintain economic stability in her business and her home.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make articles of clothing such as first communion and quinceañera dresses, as well as skirts, pants, shirts, and shorts.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is married, with two children, 8 years and 14 years. She describes herself to be a business-minded woman. 

She operates a farm where she sells milk. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her business is located within a local area, and her primary customers are daily consumers from the nearby residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a mortar to help in pumping water from her borehole. 

Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business by making sure her farm gets plenty of water.  In addition, Annah runs a retail store where she sells cereals, such as maize and beans.  She received  a loan of KES 20,000 previously, which she repaid.

loans.use: to buy a mortar for pumping water.

loans.name: Shally

texts.en:
Shally is from Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old and married, with two children. 

Shally sells religious items, such as incense and candles.  She has been in her business for 18 years and earns PHP 3,000 a month. 

In 2011, Shally joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more religious items for resale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the sales to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase religious items for resale.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is 40 years old.  He has been in farming for five years within his rural home area in Kisii, where he lives with his family of six children, ages between fifteen and seven years. His farm produces bananas, maize, and beans, which he sells to meet his family basic needs.

Evans has requested a loan of 36,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He also plans to start a retail shop business to supplement his farming business. 

His focus is to give his children better future through quality education, besides providing other basic needs, like food and clothing.

Evans concurs with other farmers that animal diseases and natural calamities like hailstorms remain the main challenges to the farming business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis, vive con su esposa, tienen un niño de un año de edad, trabaja en la siembra de maíz y ajonjolí, estos cultivos le ayudan para generar ingresos de cubrir los gastos del hogar, este trabajo lo aprendió con su padre y tiene cuatro años de estar trabajando propio ya que esto le ayuda a a mantener estable su hogar.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de seis sacos de abono y herbicidas para cultivar maíz, esto le permite mejorar la producción y prevenir las plagas que puedan afectar la cosecha.

Su objetivo es apoyar a su familia para salir con todas las necesidades más importantes, apoyándose a través del desarrollo de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his wife and one year old child. He grows corn and sesame. These items help him to generate earnings to cover household expenses. He learned this work from his father. For the past four years he has been working on his own. With this work he has been able to support his household. 
He is asking for this loan in order to buy six bags of fertilizer and herbicides for his corn crop. This will allow him to increase his production and avoid the diseases that can affect his harvest.
His goal is to help his family to have all the important necessities buy supporting them with his job.

loans.use: to buy six bags of fertilizer and herbicides.

loans.name: Nelvis

texts.es: Nelvis de 44 años vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 17 años. Ella ha trabajado como empleada dl servicio doméstico y recibió un subsidio de vivienda del Estado nacional con el cual adquirió una vivienda en el macroproyecto donde la Fundación lidera el programa de vivienda sostenible, Villas de San Pablo. Nelvis ha recibido 2 financiamientos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en un periodo de 4 años para hacer realidad su sueño de adquirir un techo donde habitar; hoy quiere continuar remodelando su vivienda y proporcionarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de educarse con calidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará materiales constructivos como baldosas,  cemento para empañetar y pintura, mejoramiento con el cual se sentirán mucho más confortables ella y su familia en su hogar.
texts.en: Nelvis is 44 years old and lives in Barranquilla with her spouse and three children, ages 8 to 17 years old. She works as a domestic worker. She lives in housing subsidized by the state. She obtained this housing through a micro project from a foundation that provides sustainable housing called San Pablo Villas. Nevis has received two loans from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in the past four years. These loans have helped her reach her dream of having a roof on her home. She continues to remodel her home and also would like to provide her children with a good education. She is applying to KIVA for a loan to buy construction materials such as tile, cement for plastering and paint. With these improvements she and her family will feel more comfortable in their home.

loans.use: to buy materials such as tile, cement for plastering and paint.

loans.name: Sam Ath's Group

texts.en:
Sam Ath is 43 years old and a married mother. She is originally from Kandal Province's Sa Ang district, Cambodia. She has four children, three of whom have their own jobs at the factory; the remaining one is still young. 

She and her husband struggle in supporting the entire household from their half hectare of farmland for rice cropping. Her husband also uses any spare time to add more income through catching fish for resale. Sam Ath has been engaging in this business for 20 years, earning almost 14,000 KHR per day. Her main challenges are the lack of working capital and the yields destroyed by insects. 

Including this new loan, she has joined VisionFund for five cycles. She has used her past four loans, which she has all repaid, with success in maintaining her household, especially in providing daily decent food for her children. Furthermore, she also can manage to save some money for her children's future.

Now, she has formed a group of two to apply for a new loan. Both women are seeking the same loan amount: 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sam Ath will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed and to pay for plowing fee; some portion will used to buy four pigs for raising as additional income. 

She hopes to earn more income in order to upgrade her living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seed; to pay for plowing, and to buy four pigs

loans.name: Martha Regina

texts.es: Martha Regina, de 53 años de edad, casada con un hijo mayor de edad, su herramienta de trabajo es la venta de queso, hamburguesas gaseosas entre otros actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 9 años los cuales, lo tiene ubicado en un barrio de su localidad, Martha Regina manifiesta seguir trabajando con la ayuda de Dios que le preste vida y el apoyo que Fundación León 2000 y el programa kiva le brinden. El financiamiento lo quiere para comprar productos los cuales ofrece a sus clientes fijos y eventuales como: queso asado, fresco, ahumado, quesillos, gaseosas, pan, carne, tomate, pepinillos.
texts.en: Martha Regina is 53 years old, and is married with one adult child. She sells cheese, hamburgers, and soft drinks, among other things. She has done this for 9 years, situated in a neighborhood in her city. Martha Regina says that she continues working with the help of God who gave her life, and the support that Fundacion Leon 2000 and the Kiva program offer her. She wants the loan to purchase products, which she sells to her regular and future customers, such as: grilled, fresh, smoked, and farmers' cheeses, soft drinks, meat, tomatoes, and gherkins.

loans.use: to purchase grilled, fresh, smoked, and farmers' cheeses, soft drinks, meat, tomatoes, and gherkins.

loans.name: Balqies

texts.en:
Balqies is a 34-year-old woman.   Her husband is a guard in a company, but earns too little income to cover household expenditures. So Balqies decided to run her own business for the betterment of their family. 

For the past five years, she has successfully run her business of buying and selling goats. Now her income has increased, and she wants to expand her business further.

Currently she requested for a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy more goats and stock up for the coming Eid season, i.e., a religious occasion where animals like goats are slaughtered in following Prophet Abraham.  She hopes to have good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Norte Grande Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Norte Grande” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; bazar, feriantes, venta de ensaladas, venta de jugos, confección de cortinas, amasandería, almacén, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de Renca, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Adriana, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un chaleco de color verde, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica a la venta de bazar surtido, se desempeña en este negocio desde hace un año. Comenta que trabaja sola en su casa, trabaja de lunes a domingo y su horario es de 15ºº hasta las 24ºº, no trabaja en la mañana ya que es muy lento y no obtiene mucho ingreso.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en distribuidoras, bodegas y supermercados a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará pilas, cintas, cartulinas, jabón, desodorante ambiental, colonias, shampo y pañales.
Una de las metas de Adriana es continuar con su negocio, seguir surgiendo y tener lo mas surtido posible su negocio y comprar una fotocopiadora así poder captar más clientela, para  generar mayores ingresos y optar a una mejor calidad de vida. 
Adriana vive junto a su esposo y una nieta de 9 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel familiar es poder terminar de arreglar su casa, para brindarle un buen pasar a su familia, y a nivel laboral crecer y vender cada vez más para seguir comprando mercadería surtida.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a la s capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Renca es una comuna ubicada en el sector norponiente del Santiago (capital de Chile), región metropolitana. Es una comuna con un fuerte trabajo comunitario, entre lo que se destaca el canal de televisión comunitario “Renca TV”, creado con el fin de promover las actividades culturales y artísticas de la comuna.
texts.en:
The Norte Grande communal bank is comprised of 18 entrepreneurs who carry out various lines of work among which are a bazaar store, stalls at fairs, selling salads, selling juices, making curtains, a bakery, a store, and providing services, among others.  All of the members belong to the Renca commune in the city of Santiago.

In the photo Adriana, a member of the communal bank, is standing in the first row, and she is the first person on the right.  She is wearing a green sweater, her hair is dark brown, and she wears it down.

She has a variety store, and she has been working in this business for one year.  She says that she works alone at her house.  She works from Monday through Sunday from 3:00 p.m. until 12:00 a.m.  She does not work in the morning because it is very slow, and she does not get much income.

She buys the merchandise she needs from distributors, grocery stores, and supermarkets.  She buys at a low cost, which is financially desirable.  She will use the loan to buy batteries, tapes, cardboard, soap, room fresheners, cologne, shampoo, and diapers.

One of Adriana’s goals is to continue with her business, to continue advancing, and to have her business stocked as much as possible.  She also wants to buy a photocopier to be able to get more customers.  She will do this to generate greater income and to have a better quality of life.

Adriana lives with her husband and a nine year old granddaughter.  Her dream on a family level is to be able to finish fixing up her house in order to give her family a good life.  On a work level her dream is to grow and to sell more each day in order to continue buying merchandise to stock.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has given her.  It has allowed her to invest in her business.  She feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs in her communal bank.  They share different activities and interests, which have served to pass the time pleasantly.  In regards to the trainings at the meetings, she has learned to run her business in a different manner.

Renca is a commune (municipality) located in the northwest area of the Santiago Metropolitan Region (Santiago is Chile's capital). It is a commune with a strong community focus, highlighted by the community television channel, Renca TV, created with the aim of promoting the commune's cultural and artistic activities.

loans.use: to buy batteries, tapes, cardboard, soap, room fresheners, cologne, shampoo, and diapers.

loans.name: Jahir Wladimir

texts.es:
Jahir Wladimir  tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la mamá y el papá en ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Jahir Wladimir  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y fréjol, además tiene animales como pollos de campo. Las compras y las ventas de los productos agrícolas lo hace en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, urea, abonos para poder trabajar mejor en el campo. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los abonos para trabajar en los cultivos.

El sueño es poder comprar tierras para poder trabajar en la siembra de maíz. En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Jahir Wladimir is 19 years old, single and has no children. He lives with his mother and father in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Rios. 
He is a member of “La Union” Communal Bank which is located in Recinto Aguas Frias. This is in the Ventanas Cantón in Ventanilla. He works in agriculture. During the short growing season he grows rice and beans. He also has farm animals such as chickens. He buys and sells his items his items in Ventanas.
He is asking for this loan in order to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and manure in order to improve his farm. With the help of this credit he will buy fertilizer to apply to his crops. 
His dream is to buy a piece of land in order to grow corn. In his free time he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea and manure in order to improve his farm.

loans.name: Chhorn's Group

texts.en:
Chhorn is the 61-year-old widowed mother of one child and also a rural villager from Sa Ang district, Cambodia. 

She strives for a living through one hectare of rice-cropping farmland. For last 38 years with her rice-planting business, she is able to earn about 11,000 KHR per day. 

Chhorn's group consists of four members.  All four are female and are seventh-time borrowers with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. With success, Chhorn  has managed to pay back all her loans consecutively, and they have made a better living for her household.  Moreover, she also can save some money for the future's needs. 

Leading her group to seek a new loan, Chhorn as the group leader will use her loan portion to buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing. 

She hopes to boost more crop yields, so she can multiply her income.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to pay for plowing.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María Auxiliadora tiene 36 años de edad de estado civil casada tiene 4 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 14, 12, 7 y 5 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

María Auxiliadora se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas, ranger. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá seguir sembrando.

El sueño es darles el estudio a los hijos, ir de paseo a la playa con toda la familia. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema en la producción.
En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con la familia.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is 36 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and with her  4 children, ages 14,12, 7, and 5 in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. 

She is a member of "LA UNION" communal bank, which is located in the Aguas Frías district, which belongs to the canton Ventanas. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture planting corn, rice, and beans. 

María Auxiliadora works in farming, planting corn and beans. She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas. 

She requests the loan to purchase seeds, urea, fertilizers, compost, insecticides, and Ranger. With the help of the loan, she will be able to continue planting. 

Her dream is to offer an education to her children, and to go for a walk on the beach with the whole family. She has not had any type of problem in production. In her free time she likes to go out for walks with the family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, urea, fertilizers, compost, insecticides, and Ranger

loans.name: Perfecto

texts.es:
Perfecto es un señor de 71  años de edad,  vive con su esposa y su madre quien es de edad avanzada en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal , en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se  destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus hermosas  playas y la variedad de fauna que posee.  Sus principales actividades económicas son el turismo y la agricultura.

Perfecto nos comenta que el único ingreso económico en la familia es el suyo, él se dedica a comprar ganado pequeño lo alimenta  hasta que obtenga el peso adecuado y lo vende en las ferias ganaderas locales, en este momento está solicitando un crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000) para comprar terneros  e iniciar el proceso de engorde  y luego venderlos a buen precio.

Perfecto es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica,destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Perfecto is a 71-year-old man. He lives with his wife and his mother, who is of an advanced age, in a community called Osa, which is located in Caña Blanca in the province of Puntarenas. This community is a much-visited rural area known for its beautiful beaches and wildlife. The main economic activities here are tourism and agriculture.
Perfecto says that he is the sole economic support for his family. He buys calves and fattens them up until they are ready to sell in the local cattle market. He is currently requesting a loan of a million colones (c1,000,000) in order to buy calves and begin the process of fattening them up and selling them for a good price.
Perfecto is a member of the Communal Credit Business of Caña Blanca, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. Thanks to the organization and the ease of obtaining credit, he is able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Duo San Luis Group

texts.es: Duo San Luis, Doña Marcela de 27 años de edad, líder de este dúo, es una mujer casada, originaria del Municipio de San Juan. Doña Marcela tiene dos niños de 6 y 4 años, se dedica a la elaboración  y venta de candelas y veladoras elaboradas en parafina desde hace 15 años actividad que aprendió de su padre, quien inicio este negocio desde hace muchos años, doña Marcela logra vender sus producto en un pequeño local en el interior del mercado de  su localidad,ella trabaja juntamente con su hermano quien se encarga de repartir la mercadería en varias tiendas, en colonias y aldeas de este municipio, está solicitando este credito para la compra de cera para elavoracion de candelas.
texts.en: Doña Marcela, who is the leader of the Duo San Luis, is 27 years old, married, and orginally from the town of San Juan.  She has two children, ages six and four.  For 15 years, she has produced and sold candles and votive candles made from parafin.  Doña Marcela learned her craft from her father who began this business many years ago.  She manages to sell her products in a small shop inside her local market, and she works alongside her brother who is responsible for distributing the merchandise to various shops in districts and towns in their municipality.  Doña Marcela is applying for this loan in order to buy wax for the production of her candles.

loans.use: to buy wax to make candles.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is 50 years old and widowed, with two children.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Doris runs a general store in the Philippines.  She sells a variety of products, such as snack foods, canned goods, and other grocery items. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Doris has been in this business for 30 years.  In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en:
Living under a thatched house located in the Pursat province's Bakan district, Khorn is one of the breadwinners in the family. She is a 51-year-old mother of five children. Her two sons have their own employment whilst another three are students and still under her responsibility.  

For the children's sake, she and her husband overcame the family's hardships by selling their handmade fish traps. They have been with this business for 15 years and are able to earn almost 15,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. 

Khorn is new to VisionFund (a Kiva partner), the same as her group members. Her group has four members; all are female. She leads this group to seek a new loan, and each member is taking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy bamboo for making more fish traps and a portion of it to buy pigs for raising as extra income. She hopes to make more income in order to sustain a good standard of living for her family.

loans.use: To buy bamboo for making more fish traps and to buy pigs.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is 26 years old. She is an energetic working woman with five years' experience and the skill of stitching both ladies and gents clothing. 

After her marriage, she felt she should help her husband in covering day to day expenditures. She owns her stitching machine, and she wants to invest in buying cloth of different colors for making stitched suits and catering to a large demand from her customers. 

She hopes to have a good experience with the new loan.

loans.use: To buy cloth of different colors in bulk.

loans.name: Olia

texts.en:
Olia is 59 years old and lives in Gardabani district. She is married, and she has a son and a daughter-in-law. Her husband works as a watchman and gets a monthly salary. 

The family runs an animal husbandry business. They own four milk cows and produce cheese. Olia is very hard-working woman, with a rich experience at her work.

Olia requested a loan to purchase food for cattle. She will purchase hay, which will be used for feeding her cows during the fall and winter.  Hay is cheap now, but the price increases by 30% to 40% in the fall months.  By buying now, Olia significantly saves on the cost of feeding the cows. She will be able to get more milk and increase the income of the family. 

With the increased income, Olia plans to build the new cattle shed.   She plans to expand the dairy farm by adding more cows, but the existing cattle shed doesn’t allow her to implement this plan.  After the building is expanded, Olia will purchase calves and raise them. 

Olia will improve the living conditions of the family. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase hay for cattle before the price goes up.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 46 years old and married, with three children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Mary Ann has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and she also earns an income from raising pigs.

Mary Ann aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

NWTF is presenting Magdalena's business for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 26 years old and single.  She lives in the Philippines.

Janeth is buying and selling copra, dried coconut meat, in her vilage. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more copra to resell.

Janeth is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more copra to resell

loans.name: Jemma

texts.en:
Jimma works hard to support her family. Jimma is married and has a trisikad (pedicab) transportation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 7 years.

Jimma requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad.  In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: buy a pedicab

loans.name: Bunra's Group

texts.en:
Bunra, a young single man, is 22 years old and a villager from Battambang province's Ek Phnom, Cambodia. 

To earn his feed, he grows paddy rice and beans as the primary source of income. To add to his income, he also raises cows and catches fish for resale. Having been in this business for seven years, he is able to earn about 39,000 KHR per day. After his daily expenses, he is able to save about 9,000 KHR each day on average. 

Bunra joined VisionFund (Kiva's partner)  two cycles ago, and he managed to pay back the entire loans already.  The past loans supported his business in a timely way and stabilized his lifestyle.  

Now, he has formed a group of three members to seek a new loan. As the group leader, he will use his loan portion to pay for harvesting his rice.  He hopes to make more healthy rice, so as to keep good progress in his life.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting fee for his rice farm

loans.name: Saret's Group

texts.en:
Saret is a 53-year-old married mother of six school-aged kids. For this big household, she can earn a decent income from her two-hectare plot of rice farmland. For past 33 years with her business, she has been able to earn about 16,000 KHR per day. 

Saret took her first loan with VisionFund in 2011 and has paid back the entire loan with success.  The previous loan has made a better support for her household as well as her business. 

Now, forming a group of three, Saret is the group leader. She is applying for 1,000,000 KHR, while her two fellow members are seeking 500,000 KHR each. Saret will use her portion of the loan to pay for harvesting fees and to buy fertilizer for her farmland. 

She expects to double her income from her business and sustain a good standard of living for her children's sake.

loans.use: to pay for harvesting fees and to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Santos De La Concepcion

texts.es: Santos de la concepción de  47 años de edad, soltera, con dos hijos, de los cuales uno está bajo su responsabilidad ya que es menor de edad y está estudiando,  Santos está solicitando el financiamiento para realizar mejoras en la vivienda, y brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia, las mejoras  consisten en construcción de cuartos y porche de la casa,  ponerle zinc a la cocina, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar material de construcción como :    zinc, cemento, cal, arena, piedrín, ladrillos, madera, alambre, clavos, bloque entre otros.
texts.en: Santos de la concepción is 47 years old, single and has two children, one of whom is her responsibility because he is still a minor and is studying. Santos is seeking this financing to make improvements to her home and to provide better security for her family. The improvements consist of the construction of rooms and a porch for the house, and putting zinc in the kitchen. She wants the financing to buy construction materials like: zinc, cement, lime, sand, stones, bricks, wood, wire, nails and slabs, among others.
