Sus principales líneas de productos diseñados, son la ropa femenina, aunque  también comercializa calzado, que compra para ofrecerlo en el mercado en la modalidad de crédito  pactado con su clientela, de acuerdo a sus posibilidades de pago.  Su sueño de prosperidad es desarrollar un punto comercial en su propia casa, donde ofrezca sus diseños y el calzado, artículos a los que su clientela accederá con mayor comodidad y en un ambiente confortable. En la actualidad utiliza las redes sociales para desarrollar su estrategia de promoción, la que también combina con visitas a domicilios de sus potenciales clientes. Gina se ha acercado ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un primer financiamiento con Kiva, para invertirlo en materias primas como telas y accesorios además de comprar calzado que su clientela ha encargado y que ella tomó nota cuando hizo su preventa.
texts.en: Gina is 37 years old. She is the mother of 2 children, who are 9 and 16 years old. She lives with them in the municipality of Soledad, where she has a business designing and selling women’s clothing. She started this business 2 years ago, selling shoes to her friends. However, like a good designer, she got the idea to create a brand of clothing. So, she began designing articles of clothing, which small businesses make for her and which she later sells herself. Her main lines of designed products are women’s clothing. However, she also sells shoes that she buys to resell by offering them on credit to her customers, according to their ability to repay. Her dream of prosperity is to open a store in her own house where she can sell her designs and shoes, items that her customers will find more accessible and in a comfortable atmosphere. She currently uses social networks for her advertizing strategy, and she combines this with visits to the homes of potential customers. Gina has come to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to apply for her first Kiva loan. She will use it to buy raw materials such as fabrics, accessories, and also shoes that her customers have ordered from her and that she took note of when doing pre-sales.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabrics, accessories, and also shoes

loans.name: Astrid Del Carmen

texts.es: Astrid de 47 años de edad es la propietaria de un negocio de confecciones, ubicado en el suroccidente de la ciudad donde vive con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 14 a 25 años, con quien sueña ver exitosos y con mucha prosperidad . Su experiencia data desde hace 30 años, cuando aprendió el arte de la costura y como siempre soñó con su propio taller, hace 11 años concretó su meta de tenerlo,  iniciando con $50.000 COP provenientes de un crédito solidario, con el cual compró su primera máquina para confeccionar.  Sus principales productos son las ropas de dormitorios como edredones, sabanas, forra colchones, cobijas y cortinas. Astrid paso a paso ha logrado tener una clientela fija, que le remite otros compradores, pero su capital de trabajo es su mayor desafío para crecer y producir en mayor volumen. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  materias primas e insumos como telas, para fabricar edredones sobrecamas, ropa de cama, todo esto fundamentado en los pedidos que hacen sus mejores clientes y en esto radica el éxito de su credikiva
texts.en: Astrid is 47 years old. She is the owner of a sewing business that is located in the southwest of the city where she lives with her husband and their 4 children, who are 14 to 25 years old. She dreams of seeing them become successful and prosperous. She has had over 30 years of experience. From the time she learned the art of sewing she has always dreamed of having her own workshop. Eleven years ago, she made her dream into reality. She started out with $50.00 in COP (Colombian pesos), which came from a small loan, which she used to buy her first sewing machine. Her main products are bedding items, such as bedcovers, sheets, mattress covers, blankets, and curtains. Astrid has come to have clients that refer other buyers to her, but working capital is her main challenge to growing and producing in greater quantities. This is why she has applied for a Kiva loan, her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy raw materials and inputs such as fabrics to make bedcovers and bed sheets. She will fulfill orders from her best clients, and in this lies the success of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and inputs such as fabrics for making bedcovers and sheets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en: A citizen from a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sophy is 41-years-old. She lives with her husband and four children, three of whom have their own employment, whereas the remaining one is still in school. The main source of family’s income is from rice farming on a half hectare of farmland; her husband works for others for a fee for extra income. Having been in this business for 18 years, they can earn about KHR 80,000 per day to support the family. Sophy is in her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now, she and her group member are requesting a loan with VisionFund of KHR 300,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to construct a decent latrine. She hopes this loan will help her family to have a healthy latrine so as to improve their hygienic standard of living.

loans.use: To construct a decent latrine.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a farmer. He mainly grows maize and kale to earn a living. He has been farming since 2009. Besides this business, he is employed. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has grown his business because he has been trained on business management skills. Paul wants to start a new business of selling charcoal and kerosene. For this reason, he has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to start the new business.

loans.use: To start a new business of selling kerosene and charcoal.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: This is a new member of PMPC named Lucia. She is 45 years of age, married, blessed with eight children, and a resident of Sawang, Maria, Siquijor.  Some of her children are school-age and the others are adult-age. She sells fish as the source of income for the family.  She has operated the business for 17 years already.  She's encouraged to be a part of PMPC and took a loan in the amount of Php 4,000 and shall be used to purchase more fish to sell. She is hoping to improve her family's living standard and provide the educational needs for their children.

loans.use: to purchase more  fish to sell

loans.name: Phoery

texts.en:
Phoery is a citizen from Kror Lanh district Of Siem Reap province. She is 37 years old and also a mother of two school-aged daughters who attend the local public school. For her daughters' sake, she grows paddy rice and supplements her income via pig raising. Having been with this business for ten years, she is able to earn about 46,000 KHR per day.

Phoery has taken out loans with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back each entire loan. The past loans have enabled her to maintain good living conditions especially in keeping her children in school and managing her business well. Now, she is applying for the third loan cycle in amount of 1,500,000 KHR. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her farmland. Moreover, she will use a portion of it to buy three more piglets for raising. She hopes to receive more yields from her cash-crop and raise her pigs healthfully so as to double her income for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, and more pigs

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Shoista

texts.en: Shoista is 22 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. Shoista studies at the pedagogical college and teaches pupils. She has a small salary; her parents are pensioners and her brother is a builder. Shoista’s family needs more money- that’s why she decided to start a new business of baking bread in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to the home finances. She studied in the course called: ‘To get ahead’ in a  women's organization and got enough skills about business. She is asking for a loan of 1000 somoni to buy flour for organizing this new business. She will get through, using the loan and her business will become a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy flour for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Yeng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, Yeng is 58 years old. She is a widowed mother of one son who is still living with her and helping the family’s business. She struggles to feed her child through rice farming, cassava and rubber plants growing. She also has used her spare time to earn extra income by working for others for a fee for almost 30 years. She can earn about KHR 10,000 per day and save about KHR 7,000 each day after the daily expenses. 

Yeng’s group consists of two female members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and successfully paid back the past loan, which relieved her family’s burden. Now she is leading the group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Yeng will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy more rubber tree seedlings. She hopes to increase her crop yield so as to make a good living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Samy's Group

texts.en: Samy is a 43-year-old mother of nine children, five of whom have their own employment, and the remaining four are still in school. To overcome the hardship of this big household, she and her husband have been farming on 4 hectares of farmland for 26 years. Besides this paddy-rice growing, her husband also works for others for a fee at cassava fields to add more income. Her main challenges are the declining price of crops and the unpredictable weather issues (flood and drought), which lower crop yields. This single business earns her about 20,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. This is her fourth loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. With success, she has paid back the past three loans and feels confident that she will gradually improve to better living conditions for her children. Now in a group of two members, she is the group leader in order to apply for a new loan. She will use her loan portion to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to double her yield so she can earn more money. By doing so, she can set aside some money to build a new, decent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en:
Sochea is single and lives in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district, where crop farming is a common way to earn a living. She is a rice farmer in the village and she supplements her income by growing maize and cabbage. She has been in this business for ten years, and earns about 29,400 KHR per day from her current business, and she is able to save about 17,000 KHR each day. The main challenge for her business is flooding, which has affected her rice paddy. 

This is the sixth loan for Sochea's group with VisionFund; both members completely repaid their previous loans, which Sochea used successfully to relieve her family's financial burden. To better support her current business, she is leading her group of two to apply for another loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland as well as paying fees for labor and water pumping. She hopes this loan will enable her to make a better living and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ratana's Group

texts.en: Ratana, 42, is a widowed mother of three school-age children. She supports her family by selling pigs she has raised. Ratana lives in a village of Monkul Borey Dstrict of Banteay Meanchey Province. As a single mother, Ratana struggles to feed her children and lacks capital in doing business. After repaying her previous loans with VisionFund, Ratana was recognized by her neighbors for her good character and was appointed to be a group leader for her fifth loan. Ratana will use her portion of the loan to buy four piglets and pig feed and hopes her pigs will grow healthy and she will able to sell them for a good price when they are big enough. She hopes to use the income generated from selling these pigs to better support her children and pay their school fees.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new laptop.

loans.name: Munawer

texts.en:
Ms. Manwar is 50 years old; she started her business on a small scale of cloth selling two years ago. Over the time, her income has increased and she is able to cover the cost of her children's expenses. She started her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and increased her work considerably. 

Her husband is not in a good physical shape to be employed. She needs to cover her household expenditures alone. For this reason, she has to expand her business activities so she requested for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy raw materials including cloth in different colors, buttons, zips, and threads, etc. This would enable her to earn large profits by catering to a large number of clients.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloth in different colors, buttons, zips, and threads, etc.

loans.name: Nhor's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham Province, Nhor is 52 years old and married with nine children who have their own employment. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for 17 years, earning about 19,400 KHR per day. Nhor also raises cows as labor to help her family's rice farming activity.

Nhor has been a member of VisionFund for one loan cycle already and she completely paid back her first loan, which has helped relieve her family's financial burden and improve their livelihood. Nhor is leading her group of four to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she wants to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her paddy field. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and to increase her rice yield to make an even better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her paddy field

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kimchea's Group

texts.en: Kimchea is 38 years old. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is a son who is school-aged and attending the local public school. She and her husband are rice farmers on three hectares of leased farmland, from which they are able to do the rice cropping one time per year. The main challenge for her is the lack of working capital for purchasing fertilizer, which lowers her productivity. To tackle her challenge, she formed a group of two female members to take out a first loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund. Both of them are applying for the same amount, KHR 250,000 each. As the group leader, she will use her loan's portion to buy fertilizer in order to boost her yields. She expects to gain more output, so she can increase her income to better her family's living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farmland

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en: Norn lives in a rural village located in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province of Cambodia. She is 56-years old and widowed with three children. She has struggled to make a living through farming rice on one and a half hectares of farmland for thirty-three years. The current business earns her approximately 10,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 5,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. This is the first loan for Norn’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She and her group members are requesting a loan with VisionFund of 500,000 KHR each. As the leader, Norn is going to use her portion to build a proper latrine. She hopes this loan will enable her family to have a clean latrine for daily consumption improving a healthy standard of living.

loans.use: To build a proper latrine.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia, Pov is 42 years-old and has four children, two daughters of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting vegetables such as cabbages, eggplants, and cucumbers, etc. Having been in this business for several years, they are able to earn about KHR 40,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. However, drought is still the main challenge for her business. Pov and one of her group members have been with VisionFund for two cycles while the other member is just in the first cycle with VisionFund. The past loans have helped her family to live better. Now leading her group to request a loan, Pov will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from the current business and buy a plot of farmland so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Ikem

texts.en:
Ikem lives in the village of Bringkeng. Her home is far away from the highway she works as a farmer. Her income is uncertain because it depends on the crop from the fields sometimes, when the weather is not bad, she gets a harvest, because she has nine children. She has a fear for the future education of her children, especially Anita, who is currently attending the vocational school. In the picture, Ikem and Anita her daughter.
Anita is child number six out of the nine siblings. Only three brothers of Anita go to school. Because the parent's income is inadequate, a motivation comes to Anita and her parents to be willing to support her from the student loan program, which gives a hope of reducing the parents' burden and allowing Anita to finish school.

loans.use: to pay education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Komisah

texts.en:
Komisah is the mother of Dian, Komisah works as a laborer with uncertain income every month. On average, her monthly income is US$50. While Dian wants to continue the education of her children, Komisah as a parent, hopes to get a loan from the student loan program of Kiva. In the picture, Komisah and Dian, her daughter.
Dian Karangsari lives in a village not far from the school. Dian's mother works in construction; her income depends on getting work to provide for the daily needs of her family. With the student loan program, Dian will use the funds to pay for school through to completion. Dian hopes to quickly begin to work as administrative staff in an office, to help her family.

loans.use: To pay educational fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira  est présidente du groupe Nuru, âgée d’environ 33 ans, mariée, mère de 3 enfants, cette cliente est très activité dans la création d’emploi. Elle sociétaire d’un atelier de coupe couture. Elle s’entraide avec son mari dans cette activité. Elle commença son business avec son fond propre par l’achat d’une machine à coudre, alors, après avoir été victime d’une catastrophe naturelle de l ‘éruption du volcan Nyiragongo vers les années 2002. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF Hekima pour le renforcement. Elle vient de réaliser 19 cycles des crédits. Elle installe son atelier au le marché central de Virunga. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’approvisionner de tissus dames, tissus pour confection veste pour hommes, boutons,popeline, papiers, ciseaux, etc. En plus, elle ambitionne déménager et s’installe vers le centre ville pour plus de visibilité et gagner plus des marchés. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.
texts.en:
The customer, Kavira, is the leader of the Nuru group. She is about 33 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. This customer plays an active role in the creation of jobs. She works in a dressmaking and sewing workshop. She and her husband work together in this business. She started her business by buying a sewing machine with her own funds, after having been a victim of a natural catastrophe - the eruption of the Nyiragongo volcano in 2002. Later on, she received a loan from the MFI Hekima to augment her funds. She has just completed 19 loan cycles.

Kavira sets up her workshop at the central market of Virunga. This new loan will be used to buy items including fabric with which to make women's clothing and men's jackets, buttons, poplin, paper and scissors. She also aims to move her business and re-establish it close to the centre of town, to gain more visibility and new markets. The customer thanks Hekima for its actions to support disadvantaged people excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy fabric with which to make women's clothing and men's jackets, buttons, poplin, paper, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Huy

texts.en:
Huy was born in 1993. He lives in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. He is studying business administration at Ha Noi College of Economy and Technology (www.hcet.edu.vn). His course lasts three years and he will graduate in 2014. He is the first person in his family to graduate high school and go to study in college.

His mother is Mrs. Thao, a member of SEDA’s credit program. Huy's parents have a grocery store and get from it 7,000,000 VND per month. He is aware that studying will give him opportunities to find a good job and earn more money. He chooses this job because of his business passion. 

Huy wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to pay for his education fees. This loan suits his family’s situation and income.  The loan is disbursed fast and conveniently right after completing the paperwork. Besides lacking education fees, he has other difficulties like house rental and transportation. He appreciates the humanity of this program and he will try his best to study and work for the best future.

In this picture, there are Huy and his mother.

loans.use: to pay for his education fees

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong was born in 1992. She lives in Bac Ninh – the smallest province in Vietnam. She is studying in a Banking major at Bac Ha Technological College. Her course lasts three years and she will graduate in 2013. She is the first person in her family to graduate high school and go to study in college. Her father is a farmer and her mother is a teacher. Her mother is Cuc, a member of SEDA’s credit program too. Her family is her motivation and her support in choosing her major. 

Phuong plans to work in the capital, Hanoi, within the next 5 to 10 years. She understands that learning helps her to integrate into society and gives her opportunities to have a highly-paid job. She wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to buy a computer to improve her skills in technology and support her study. This loan suits her family’s situation and income. The paperwork is fast and convenient for her needs. Beside lacking education fees, she has other difficulties such as not having study tools, study materials, and transportation. Vietnam and Bac Ninh are becoming more and more developed and that requires that our labor must have a higher educational level.

In this picture, there are Phuong and her mother.

loans.use: to buy a computer to improve her skills in technology and support her studies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 29 years old, a single mother of a three-year-old child. She is a tailor, a business she started a year ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 30,000 to purchase an embroidery machine and cloth materials. The profit she makes will help her buy additional stock for her business. Her dream is to see her business expand and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and fabrics.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in the Likoni area of Coast province. He has five children. He owns a farming business which he has been operating for thirty-eight years now. He started the business through his own savings.

He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operation of the business.

David is applying for a loan of 31,500 Kenya shillings to buy fertilizer and employ more workers. His extra income from the loan will be added to savings to increase his savings. His future plans are to expand the business by opening a wholesale shop for his farm products.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and employ more workers.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is widowed with four children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her niece and nephew). She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent for her business premises, and utility bills.   

Christine sells used shoes. She has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She sells to all categories of people and works seven days out of every week. She generates additional income by selling ladies' handbags and peasant farming. Her business challenges include seasonality and bad debts. She aspires to someday import used shoes and also to earn enough profits to build her business premises and rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru:
Мария живет в Хусте, ей 63 года. Мария – вдова. Она – на пенсии. Мизерной пенсии совсем не хватает, поэтому Мария дополнительно подрабатывает, убирая в магазине, а также сдает комнату студентам-заочникам, которые приезжают учиться в город.  

Мария обратилась в КИВА за кредитом, потому что ей необходимы средства для приобретения новой мебели для кухни, а также новая кровать. Здоровье Марии уже давно не то, что было. Ей все труднее спать на старой, неудобной кровати. Она давно мечтала о возможности приобрести новую, чтобы было легче спать и меньше болела спина. К тому же с возрастом все больше хочется уюта в доме, поэтому Мария решила за счет средств, полученных от КИВА, заодно приобрести и кухонную мебель, заменив давно износившуюся старую.
texts.en:
Mariya is a 63-year-old widow and pensioner living in Khoost. Her meager pension is simply not enough, and so she earns extra money cleaning a store and renting a room to part-time students that come to study in her city. 

Mariya has turned to Kiva for a loan because she can no longer avoid getting а new bed and new furniture for her kitchen. She has had health problems for some time, and it is becoming more and more difficult for her to sleep on her old, uncomfortable bed. She has long dreamed of the possibility of buying a new one so that she can sleep easier and her back will hurt less. Additionally, as she gets older, she would like more and more to have a cozy home. Mariya therefore decided that through Kiva funding she can purchase both a new bed and new kitchen furniture, replacing her furniture that has been worn out for a long time.

loans.use: to purchase a new bed and new furniture for her kitchen

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school.  She does not take care of any additional family members.  

Agnes has a beauty salon and has been in this business for eight years. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, and weaves.  She works from home and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the ever increasing prices of cream relaxers. She aspires to own a bridal salon and also to own a fully stocked beauty salon. She resides in her own house and her family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding her family.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, and braids

loans.name: Yuvenalis

texts.en:
Yuvenalis is 52 years old, and he has been in mixed farming for five years in his rural home in Kisii, South Rift, Kenya.  It is a region popular with sugarcane and tea growing. 

His farm produces sugarcane, beans, bananas, and maize. He is married, with three children, aged between 20 and 16 years. He also makes building bricks to supplement farming income.

Yuvenalis has made a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo.  He will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says dairy farming is his latest farming venture.  It will provide supplementary meals besides earning income to meet other basic needs.

Yuvenalis has intentions of running a farm of four hybrid dairy cows to ensure better income. He says, however, that the theft of farm produce before harvest and animal diseases remain some of the major challenges in farming business.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya.  He is married and has three children all of whom attend school.  He has a transport business which he has been operating for four years.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group, and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is finding customers.

Sammy is applying for a loan of 15,850 Kenya Shillings to buy spare parts for his motorbike and service his motorbike.  Any extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his standard of living.  His dream is to buy other means of transport and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy parts and service for his motorbike.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married and she tells us that she’s a merchant; she’s had a food stall for one year that’s in a good location, which is a good advantage because she gets many customers that way. Riziki is a very enterprising woman who wants to get ahead very much and continues to grow her business. She comments that at the beginning her business was small, but afterwards thanks to her work and arduous effort, she’s been able to grow and improve her and her family’s income.

She asks for the loan to buy sacks of beans, cooking fat oil, wheat flour, rice, etc. that she uses to make the food for her food stall. She’s very grateful for this opportunity she’s getting since it will be of much help to her.

loans.use: to buy sacks of beans, cooking fat oil, wheat flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Edelya

texts.ru: Edelya vot uje 20 let kak vedet selskoxozaystvennoe delo. U nee 3 korovi v xozaystve I ona prodayet molochnie produkti I masyo. Edelye 55, ona zamujem s 4 detmi vozrastov ot 25 do 35. Deti pomogayut ey vo vsem a muj rabotaet I poluchaet zarplatu 200 AZN. Edelya xochet sdelat remont doma, ona obratilas za summoy 1600 AZN chtobi kupit stroymateriali.
texts.en: Edelya has already managed affairs on her settlement for 20 years.  She has three cows and she sells milk and butter.  Edelya is is 55, and is married with four children aged between 25 and 35.  Her children provide all kinds of help, and her husband has a job which earns him 200 AZN.  Edelya wants to make some repairs to her home, and is applying for a loan of 1,600 AZN to buy building materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make repairs at home.

loans.name: Viktor

texts.ru:
Виктор живет в  г. Каменке-Днепровской, который находится в  Запорожской области в Украине. Живет с женой и детьми. Дети уже взрослые помогают ему в хозяйстве. У Виктора большой бизнес. У него есть тепличное хозяйство и животноводческий комплекс для свиней.  В этом бизнесе она работает уже 12 лет.

Виктор планирует вложить кредит в 20 000 гривен, полученный от КИВА в закупку зерна для животных.  Предложили купить 10 тонн зерна по выгодной цене, поэтому понадобился кредит. Виктор очень активный и целеустремленный, старается  всегда добиваться поставленных целей. 12 лет назад ему очень повезло, он приобрел тепличное хозяйство за небольшую сумму. Там много земли, поэтому он сразу же запланировал построить животноводческий комплекс. На сегодняшний день эта мечта осуществилась и  этот бизнес приносит Виктору хороший доход. Кредит поможет Виктору вырастить недавно родившихся поросят.
texts.en:
Viktor lives with his wife and children in the city of Kamenke-Dneprovskaya, which is located in the Zaporozhskaya region of Ukraine.  His children are already grown and they help him on the farm.  Viktor has a large business, which includes a greenhouse and a breeding complex for pigs.  He has been in this line of work for 12 years.

Viktor plans to use his Kiva loan of 20,000 hryvnas to invest in grain for his animals.  He was offered a purchase of 10 tons of grain at a good price, which is why he needs this loan.  Very active and dedicated, Viktor is always trying to reach his goals.  He had a stroke of good luck 12 years ago, when he was able to purchase a greenhouse at a very reasonable price.  The greenhouse was on a large plot of land, so he immediately made plans to build a breeding complex.  Today, Viktor's dream has come true and his business brings him a good income.  This loan will help Viktor raise his new piglets.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his livestock

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en: Zipporah used her previous loan to buy dairy feed and mash for the chicks. With the loan, her business improved and the chicks matured and she sold them, making good profits. She was able to save more profit from the additional income.  She has requested another loan of 60,000 KES to buy 600 chicks and chicks mash.

loans.use: to buy 600 chicks and chicks mash.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 34 years old and lives in a small village in the Kareli district. He is married and lives with his parents. David has a 1-year-old son. His father is provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have 2 hectares of apple garden, 2 hectares of owned and rented agricultural land where different kinds of vegetables and cereal crops are grown: tomatoes, garlic, onion, haricot, wheat. David sells his produce at the local open market. He is also successfully involved in an animal husbandry business and has 2 milking cows, 4 calves and 2 pigs. David produces cheese and pork and sells locally. He is a very hardworking man, with rich experience in his work.

David requested a loan to purchase his rented land, where he has an apple garden. He will be able to make the land private. The family will work hard during the spring and summer seasons, and after the seasonal work is properly done they hope to get a good harvest. As a result of this Kiva loan, the family’s income will increase, which will enable them to improve the family’s living conditions. David hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase his rented land.

loans.name: Shurbat

texts.en: Mrs. Shurbat is 60 years old and lives with her niece in a small house in the Selenge province, Mongolia. Her niece, Egchiglen, is 10 years old and is a second level school student.  Mrs. Shurbat's husband is deceased. She started to repair shoes in the Gurvan Mergid market in 1973. She has collected much business and work experience in her field. She is a hardworking and honest person. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 54 years old, married, and blessed with four children.  To earn a living, he does poultry farming.  He has been in the business for four years.  He has witnessed his business growing since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills.

Paul has requested 40,000 KES to buy layers and chicks mash.

loans.use: to buy layers and chicks mash.

loans.name: Nahed

texts.en:
Nahed, who appears in the picture inside her house, is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and a mother to two sons and four daughters between the ages of 6 and 20.  Her husband is employed, but the salary he gets isn't enough to cover the family's needs and pay their education costs.

Nahed wants to completely finish her new house, so she is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help her cover the cost of purchasing and installing tiles. This loan will improve the living conditions in Nahed's house so the family can move into the house soon and enjoy living in it.

loans.use: To install tiles and completely finish the house.

loans.name: Florentina

texts.en:
Florentina is a 50-year-old married woman who runs a sari-sari or convenience store in Bohol, Philippines. She has six children and some of them are still in school. She sells snack foods, canned goods, sodas and others. This provides her the income that she needs. She works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially the education of her children. As this time she is in need of additional capital for her business. 

She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of merchandise to sell, such as noodles, canned goods, sodas and others. With this, she will be able to attract more customers in their community, thus increasing her sales and income. Florentina dreams of expanding her business and making it a success. Any additional income generated from the venture will be used for daily family needs, to pay school fees, reinvestment in the same business and as savings.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of merchandise to sell, such as noodles, canned goods, sodas and others.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a dairy farmer.  She has been farming for two years and has employed one person in the business.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business because she has been trained in business management skills. Janet has requested a loan of 70,000 KES to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Muhayokhon

texts.en:
Muhayokhon is a hardworking person who is married and has a 5-year-old son. She has been busy with animal husbandry more than 8 years.  Thanks to the animals' good condition, she has managed to win a large quantity of customers for her business. She sells her animals in the local market and has many customers. From profit she bought a car and uses it in the business. She has additional income from farming. She grows crops.
  
Muhayokhon is looking for a loan to buy young cattle and mineral fertilizers. In this way she will be able to offer her customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing her household with good earnings. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and livestock.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 56 years old and married. They are blessed with two children whom he supports. For twelve years he has operated a game entertainment business with water pool tables, earning a monthly income of about KES 100,000. 

He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, with which he plans to purchase another water pool table to enable him to meet the market demands of his customers.

He will invest the anticipated profits back into his business. His future plans and hopes are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase another water pool table to enable him to meet the market demands of his clients.

loans.name: Crescencia

texts.en:
Crescencia is a 55-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She has run a food vending business for more than 15 years now. This is the source of her income which she uses for the family's expenses and needs. She works hard to earn a living to support the family.

At this time, she lacks capital for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business, such as meat, seasonings, vegetables and others. With this, she will be able to cook more food and cater to the customers in their locality.

Crescencia dreams of improving her business to generate more income for their sustenance and needs. Moreover, she wants to improve their way of living and experience the fullness of life together with her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her food vending business, such as meat, seasonings, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Sabin

texts.en:
Sabin is 51 years old and is married with seven children between the ages of 6 and 22 years old. He is a shoemaker. 

Sabin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his shoe business by making more shoes to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To expand his business by making more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Magret Abuni

texts.en:
Magret is a 43-years-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has 6 children between the ages of 5 and 21. All of them go to school.

Magret runs a clinic and has been in this business for 5 years. She has 2  employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through her clients. She is taking a loan of 2000 SDG to purchase tablets and other items. In addition to this business she has no other source of income.

In 5 years magret  would like to expand her  business. Her  major challenges include high  prices in the market. Magret  says she is happy for the loan given by Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy more drugs like syrups and tablets.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 7 children. 

Joseph provides motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

Joseph has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Joseph hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Azmi

texts.en:
Azmi is a 50-year-old man. He is married and a father to four sons and two daughters; their ages are between 25-5 year old.

Azmi is the head of the agriculture workers union in Jenin City, but the salary he gets isn't enough to cover this expenses.

For the past six years, Azmi has been working in agriculture with the rest of the family members. He has a greenhouse and wants to purchase fertilizers and additional plastic to cover the greenhouse well. He is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to cover the costs of purchasing the needed fertilizers and plastic. It will allow Azmi to produce a better crop and thus increase the sales and improve the family's income.

Azmi is photographed inside the his greenhouse.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and plastic for the greenhouse to improve its condition.

loans.name: Dieunedort

texts.fr: Dieunedort est un homme de 33 ans, élibataire père de deux enfants de 7 et 10 ans. tous deux vont  a l'ecole. Dieunedort a une alimentation (petit commerce general)dans laquelle il commercialise le petit déjeuné , les friandises, et les petits produits de première necessité dans un quartier de la place. Il gere cette alimentation depuis 1 deja. Il a aquise et fidelise une clientele grace a sa bonne experience dans ce domaine de commercialisation de produit de consommation courante. Il sollicite ce credit pour augmenter son stock de marchandise(4 sacs de riz, 5 cartons de savons), afin de satisfaire sa clientele de plus en plus grandissante. Ceci lui permettra d'augmenter ses benefices qui l'aideront a grandir son activite en achetant plus de produits et en subvenant a ces besoins et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dieunedort is a 33-year-old man who is single and the father of 2 children aged 7 and 10. Both children attend school. Dieunedort owns a small, local general store where he sells breakfast, sweets and small essential supplies. He has been running the store for a year already. He has acquired a loyal customer base thanks to his good experience in selling commodities. 

He is requesting this loan so that he can increase his product inventory (with 4 bags of rice and 5 boxes of soap) in order to satisfy the demand of his growing clientele. This will allow him to increase his profits, which will enable him to grow his business by buying more products, and will also enable him to meet his own needs and those of his family.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of rice and 5 boxes of soap.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en su trabajo de campo, realizando el cultivo de maíz y frijol, se comprará abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, que son necesarios para aplicarlos al cultivo, ya que éstos previenen las plagas y también fortalecen la producción.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener un efecto positivo, ya que con los insumos agrícolas ha podido mejorar la producción en una manzana de terreno, de esto han logrado comercializar y proveer a su familia algunos ingresos para cubrir los gastos mas necesarios.
texts.en:
Julio has decided on a new loan in order to to be able to invest in his work in the field carrying out the cultivation of corn and beans.  He will buy manure, herbicides and insecticides which are necessary to apply to the crops since these prevent pests and also strengthen production.

With the previous loan he managed to have a positive effect since with the agricultural supplies he has been able to improve the production on about 1.72 acres of land.  He has managed to sell from this and provide some income for his family to cover their most necessary expenses.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicide and insecticide.

loans.name: Sultonboi

texts.en:
Sultonboi is 54 years old. He is married and has two children. He began his own business in animal husbandry seven years ago. Now, he is one of the best and most successful businessmen in the local market. He has six cows and 10 sheep. Thanks to his work, his cows are fat and attract a lot of customers. He earns additional income from growing wheat. 

Sultonboi wants to buy more cows so he can develop his business but he does not have the money to do this. For this reason, he is asking for a loan of $2400 to buy cows. In this way, he will be able to provide his family with quality living conditions. He promises to make his payments on time. He awaits your support and thanks you.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 67 years old and married with seven children. He does mixed farming to earn a living. He has been farming for more than 30 years.  

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his farming business because he has been trained on business management. This has helped him to grow his business.

Michael has requested a loan of 60,000 KES to renovate his cow shed and to buy a cow and animal feed.

loans.use: To renovate his cow shed and to buy animal feed and a cow.

loans.name: Sonja

texts.en:
Sonja is from Kosovo. She lives in a small village in a Serbian community. She is married and is a mother of four children, ages 9 to 18 years old. All four of her children attend school. Her husband receives a pension from the company that he used to work for before the war.

Now, Sonja works together with her husband in an agricultural business. She has been busy with this kind of business for a long time. Sonja and her husband are earning money by working on their neighbor's land.

As agriculture is the main source of income for Sonja's family, she is requesting a loan to buy agricultural machinery and tools for working on the land. She is very grateful to KIVA lenders for the financial support given to help her family.

loans.use: To buy agricultural machinery and tools for working on the land.

loans.name: Nergis

texts.en:
Ms. Nergis is a 37-year-old working woman. After she married, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education.

Nergis is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 30,000 PKR to purchase good-quality clothes of different colors. She hopes to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase good-quality clothes of different colors.

loans.name: Leila Maribel

texts.es: La señora Leila,  tiene 54 años de edad, es casada, vive en el municipio de Omoa, Cortes, junto a su hijo y un nieto. Ella tiene 7 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de pulpería, donde vende productos comestibles como: arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, embutidos, refrescos, churros, pan, dulces, huevos, lácteos etc. esta solicitando un préstamo por 5,000 Lempiras para surtir mas el negocio, ya que tiene buena demanda, comprara granos básicos, embutidos, refrescos, jugos y abarrotes. Quiere que su negocio sea estable, mantenerlo siempre surtido para vender más para tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Leila is 54 years old.  She is married and lives in the municipality of Omoa in Cortes, together with her son and one grandchild.  It's been seven years since she established her own convenience store business where she sells food products such as rice, sugar, corn, beans, sausages, sodas, churros (a kind of doughnut), bread, sweets, eggs, dairy products, etc.  

Leila is requesting a loan of 5,000 lempiras to better stock her business as she has good demand.  She will purchase basic grains, sausages, sodas, juice, and groceries.  She wants her business to be stable, and to keep it always stocked so that she can sell more and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, sausages, sodas, juice, groceries, sugar, etc. to stock up her business.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.fr: Antoinette est une femme de 45 ans mère d'enfants. elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 17 ans déjà. Elle commercialise le charbon et les vivres secs et frais en fonction des saisons. C'est grace à cette activté qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famuille. mais là petité de son capital ll'empêche d'acheter ses marchandises en gros et réaliser un bénéfice important. elle obligé d'acheter en détail d'ouù l'importance de ce crédit dans son activité parce que grace à ce crédit elle pourra acheter les sacs de charbon et de pistaches ceci  pour éviter les ruptures de stocks, satisfaire sa clientèle et augmenter sa marge bénéficiare. Benéfice qu'elle économisera pour la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
Antoinette is a 45-year-old mother. She has been selling goods at a market in the capital city for 17 years now.

She sells charcoal and both dried and fresh food depending on the season. Her business allows her to support her family, but her small amount of capital prevents her from buying goods in bulk and thus earning bigger profits. She has to buy her goods individually, which is why this loan is so important for her business. The loan will enable her to buy bags of charcoal and pistachios so that she can avoid running out of stock, satisfy her customers, and increase her profit margin.

She will use the profits to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to diversify her goods and increase her inventory of charcoal

loans.name: Ronalyn

texts.en:
Ronalyn is a 23-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children ages 3 and 2. They are residing in Bohol, Philippines. Ronalyn and her husband have been in the fishing business for three years now. This is the source of the family income.

Ronalyn joined CEVI because she wants to gain access to the financial and training services offered by the organization. As of this time, she is asking for a loan worth 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy additional fishing net and to pay for the repair and maintenance of their fishing boat. With this, her husband could enhance his daily catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

Ronalyn dreams of expanding her business and making it a success. Moreover, she wants to save for the future schooling of her children. She believes that it is every child's right to be given a good education and a good life.

loans.use: to buy new fishing net.

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is 39 years old. She lives in the Tskaltubo District with her mother, who is a pensioner, and her 4 year old daughter.  Inga and her mother have a vineyard and sell wine at the local open market. The average monthly income of the family is 300 Laris, which is hardly enough to buy food for a three-member family. According to Credo’s estimate, the family falls into the “subsistence-poor” category. 

Inga has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural start-up business, but without any success. Her requests were always rejected, because of her family’s low income and poor living conditions.  Inga then requested a loan from Credo to start a new business: apiculture (beekeeping). Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.  This start-up loan program provides credit to the rural poor who do not have access to it, and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With this loan Inga will purchase 40 bee-hives with bee colonies, and place them in an old empty farm building located in their yard. Inga will work hard.  She will produce honey and sell it along with her wine in the village and at the local open market. Her new business, financed with this Kiva start-up loan, will double the family’s income and allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bee-hives and bee colonies

loans.name: Ahad

texts.en:
Ahad is an entrepreneurial person who is married and has three children. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than five years. He sells his animals in the local market and has many customers. Many of his customers are local butchers, who are glad for his work. Now he has two cows and two sheep. Also, he grows grass for cattle to graze.
 
Ahad is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. In this way, he will be able to offer his customers good animals and continue to make financial progress, providing his household with good earnings. Each month, he will make his payments on time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has two children who are 4 years and 6 years old. She describes herself to be loyal and a good woman. 

She operates a mini-supermarket, where she sells various items such as sugar, salt, toiletries, margarine, bread, cooking fat, beauty products, etc. She has been involved in this business for five years and employs three staff members. Her business is located within a busy business environment, and her primary customers are all from the local environs. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of household items. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more household items. Her business goal is to run a bigger mini-supermarket within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will run a big shopping mall.

loans.use: to buy more household products.

loans.name: Jawad

texts.en:
Jawad is a 54-year-old man. He is married and a father to three sons and two daughters.

For the past three years, Jawad has had a restaurant for making falafel sandwiches for customers, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income to the family, but does not yet bring in enough money to cover the family's expenses and cover the costs of work.

Jawad is requesting a $3,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a machine for making and frying falafel to speed up the process of his work and provide better quality to his loyal customers. This will increase sales and improve Jawad's income.

Jawad is photographed in his restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a machine for making and frying falafel, a traditional dish.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is 36 years old and lives in a small village of Gardabani district. He is divorced and lives with his sons (14 and 18 years old). The younger son attends the village school. 

Teimuraz runs his agricultural business. Teimuraz’s two sons help their father with agriculture. He owns four milking cows and three calves. Teimuraz makes cheese from the milk he gets and sells it at the local open market. Besides this business, he is involved in meat trading. He is a very hardworking, responsible person with a lot of experience in his work.

Teimuraz requested a loan to expand his meat business.  With this loan, he will purchase more meat and resale at a good price.  He will increase his trade capital and make his business more profitable. Taking into account the above-mentioned, the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase meat for resale

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 62 years old, married, and has a 30-year-old child. She has been practicing dairy farming for 12 years. She has been able to improve her business since he joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. 

Christina hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Otilia Argentina

texts.es:
Otilia, solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprarse dos sacos de maíz, un quintal de papas, aceite, leña, plátanos, leche y azúcar, entre otros materiales que son necesarios para la producción en su negocio, este préstamo le dará los recursos económicos para que ella continué trabajando.

Con el préstamo anterior logró realizar una gran inversión, ya que el precio de los materiales disminuye a comprarlo por mayor, le dio un mejor margen de ganancia,  su familia y su condición continúan estable y considera que su negocio está prosperando.
texts.en:
Otilia is requesting a new loan to buy two sacks of corn, one “quintal” [1 quintal = 100 kg.] of potatoes, oil, firewood, bananas, milk, and sugar, among other materials needed for production in her business.  This loan will give her the financial resources for her to continue working.

With the previous loan she managed to make a big investment because the price of the materials is less when buying wholesale.  It gave her a better margin of income, and her family and their condition continues to be stable.  She feels that her business is prospering.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of corn, one “quintal” [1 quintal = 100 kg.] of potatoes, oil, firewood, bananas, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Alfonce

texts.en:
Alfonce lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya. He has four children and has been doing his work for 20 years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and personal business.

Alfonce was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "For the time [I have] been in Juhudi, I know its goodness."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session, and he said he has learned how to invest wisely.

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Alfonce replied that from the loan investment, he will be able to save for his children's school fees as they're almost joining high school. He will be able to increase his asset base too.

Alfonce also stated what is most enjoyable about farming: He loves farming and seeing his crops grow, and the harvest is very satisfying! His biggest challenge is fluctuating demand during the high and low seasons. Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Super" and "Mrembo."

List of assets to choose from: [Cow, Poultry, Pig, Bicycle, Motorcycle, Automobile, Tractor, Pump]
Given the above list of assets, Alfonce owns the following: [cow] [poultry] [bicycle]

List of household items to choose from: [mosquito net, electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD]
Given the above list, Alfonce's household has the following: [net]

*****For this profile template, Juhudi Kilimo is making microfinance more efficient by gathering information using a mobile device in the field and sending the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper and keeping costs down!*****

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lydie

texts.en:
Lydie is 51 years old, married, and has four children. 

She purchases and sells charcoal. She has been in this business for one year, and she works from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day. She currently employs one person to help her.
 
Lydie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jeanne D Arc

texts.fr: Jeanne est une femme âgéé de 42 ans célibataire et mère de 03 enfants dont l'age varie entre 8 et 22 ans. elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place où elle vend les vivres frais(tomates, ignames, oignons) depuis 15 ans déjà.C'est grace à cette activité qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. La longue expérience dans ce domaine, la bonne connaissance de ses fournisseurs lui permettre d'acheter à de bon prix pour pouvoir ameliorer son activité. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter le stock de ses vivres à savoir un filet d'oignon, un filet d'1gnames et des cajots de tomates. Avec les bénéfices lui permettront d'agrandir son activité et éconiser le reste pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jeanne is a 42-year-old single mother of three children, who are aged between 8 and 22 years of age. She works selling fresh foodstuffs in a local market (tomatoes, yams and onions), and has done so for 15 years now. It is thanks to this business that she can provide for her family. Her long experience in this area and the fact that she knows her suppliers well means that she can buy at good prices, thereby improving her business. 

Jeanne has requested this loan to increase her stock of foodstuffs, by buying one bag of onions, one sack of yams and some crates of tomatoes. The profits generated will allow her to increase her business, as well as to save the rest of the money for her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy crates of tomatoes, sacks of onions and yams.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Mzia

texts.en:
Mzia is 47 years old and lives in the Kareli district with her large family. She is married and has a daughter, a married son with two children, and a mother-in-law. Her daughter and husband have chronic health problems and get a relevant pension from the local government. Mzia’s mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. 

Mzia runs an agricultural business. In particular Mzia owns a plot of land where tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, barley, wheat, onion and garlic are grown. The family is involved in an animal husbandry business as well. They have two milking cows, two calves, two pigs and 14 piglets. Mzia produces cheese and sells it at the local open market. She is a hardworking woman who is responsible and very well known in the area for her big heart and friendliness with others. 

She requested a loan to purchase wheat seeds and cultivate land. After cultivating the land, she will be able to sow wheat and get an abundant harvest. Part of the harvested wheat will be used by the family and the rest will be sold locally. Mzia will work hard, especially in spring and summer seasons, to get a good harvest. After selling her agricultural production she will get planned income and Mzia will be able to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and cultivate land.

loans.name: Darwin Stalin

texts.es:
Darwin Stalin tiene 25 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los papás en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA UNION, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías, Perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol.

Darwin Stalin se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz además trabaja desojado maíz de otras personas. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, insecticidas, líquido para maleza, abonos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los líquidos para las plagas.

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las plagas como la alangosta y el cogollera. El sueño es poder comprar una finca.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de compras.
texts.en:
Darwin Stalin, age 25, is single and has no children.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas in the Los Riós province.  He is a member of the La Union communal bank.  It is located in the Aguas Frías district, which is In the Ventanas canton.  This communal bank devotes itself to growing short cycle corn, rice, and beans.

Darwin Stalin grows corn, and he also works husking corn for other people.  He makes his purchases and sales in Ventanas.

He is requesting the loan to buy urea, insecticides, liquid weed killer, and fertilizers.  With the help of the loan he will be able to buy liquids for pest infestations.  The challenges he faces are the infestations from worms and “alangostas”.  His dream is to be able to buy a farm.

In his free time he likes to go shopping.

loans.use: to buy urea, insecticides, liquid weed killer, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
Jose, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en el pago de colegiaturas pues ha iniciado sus estudios superiores, este préstamo le ayudará para pagar  las mensualidades y otros gastos en útiles, sera un apoyo a que pueda forjarse una carrera que le permita mejorar su oportunidades profesionales.

Con el préstamo anterior logró tener buenos beneficios en el negocio de venta de comida rápida, hoy en día lo está realizando su madre ya que él se ha decidido por estudiar, espera continuar trabajando apoyando su madre a través de estos préstamos y que también pueda terminar sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Jose is seeking a new loan to pay for his college course which he has just started. This loan will help him pay for monthly expenses and other items such as school supplies. It will be a great help as he sets out on a new career path which will allow him to have better professional opportunities.

With his previous loan he succeeded in earning more money in his fast food business which his mother is now taking over as he has decided to go back to school. Jose hopes to carry on working and helping his mother through these loans and also to finish his further education.

loans.use: Pay for a college course and buy school supplies

loans.name: Simona

texts.es: Simona Es originaria de San Martin Jilotepeque, tiene 59 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 15 años en el mercado municipal de su localidad, aparte de dedicarse a esta actividad también se dedica a la crianza de pollos como actividad secundaria,  está solicitando este crédito para la compra de pollos ya que necesita tener más animalito y así poder venderlos cuando ya están grandes. Espera que le puedan dar ese apoyo que necesita para salir adelante.
texts.en: Simona is from San Martin Jilotepeque. She is 59 and has sold vegetables for 15 years in the local municipal market. Apart from this, she also raises chickens as a secondary occupation. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of chickens because she needs more animals. She will be able to sell them once they are large. She hopes that you can give her the support she needs to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy chickens for raising, to be sold when they are larger.

loans.name: Kaundia

texts.en:
Kaundia is a 37-year-old married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be social and talkative man. He operates a motorcycle with which he provides transport services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located within a busy market. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor road networks that are impassible. 

He will use the 70,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan to buy a new motorcycle. His business goal is to buy a taxi for improving his transportation services within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise (clothing, shoes).

loans.name: Bonaventure

texts.en:
Bonaventure is 26 years old and is married with two children who are two and four years old. He sells shoes from a store which operates from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m. every day. He currently employs one person to help him and he has eleven years of experience in this work. 

Bonaventure has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more shoes to resell. He plans to use any profits generated from this loan to satisfy his family's basic needs and to buy a house.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is now 55 years old and their two children are still in college. Her catering business is still doing well and she is still getting enough income for the rental houses. 

She is now in her third cycle and is planning to use this loan to buy more bales of wheat flour, cooking fat and maize flour and to carry out some repairs on one of her rental houses. She plans to use the anticipated profits to sustain her catering business.

She is hoping to start a hotel in the future.

loans.use: to buy bales of wheat flour, cooking fat and maize flour, and to repair one of her rental houses.

loans.name: Emmanuelle Murielle

texts.fr: Murielle est une jeune femmme de 22 ans commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 1 ans. elle a ouvert un call box dans le quel elle commercialise les crédits de communication et autres friandises c'est grace à cette activité qu'elle subvient à ses besoins. C'est une activité qui rapporte quand tu as assez d'unités de crédit de communication. mais sans à un capital important, elle ne parvient pas à réaliser un bénéfce important, elle a des ruptures permantes de stocks parce qu'elle obliger de tous pour pouvoir réacheter d'où l'insatisfaction constance de sa clientèle qui se tourne vers la concurence. C'est pour ces raisons qu'elle sollicte ce crédit qui lui permettra d'augmenter le montant de ses crédit de communication. Elle économisera une partie de ces bénéfices pour se réinscrir à l'école et le reste sera réinvesti dans son activté pour l'agrandir.
texts.en: Murielle is a 22-year old woman who has been working as a vendor in one of the capital city’s districts for one  year. She has opened a stand where she sells phone recharge cards and other small items. She supports herself thanks to this work. This line of business brings profit when you have sufficient recharge cards. However, without sufficient capital she does not manage to earn a sizeable profit. She keeps running out of stock since she needs to [sell] everything in order to replenish her stock. As a result, her customers are disappointed and turn to competitors. This is why she is seeking a credit that will allow her to increase the volume of her phone recharge cards. She will save part of her revenues in order to pay for her studies, and the rest will be reinvested in her business to grow it further.

loans.use: to expand her stock of cell phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Alhaji Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you this group of teachers from one of the secondary schools in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. 

These hardworking and dedicated teachers have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 16,800,000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful projects that their mere salaries alone cannot enable them to do. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy house-building materials, some will buy a piece of land or pay school fees for their children, while some of them will invest the loan in business.
 
Alhaji is the leader of this group of teachers. He was born in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city, 58 years ago. Alhaji is married to a trader and the couple has seven children who are attending secondary and tertiary institutions. Alhaji has served in the teaching profession for 28 years now. He is going to use his share of the loan to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.name: Galamkar

texts.ru: Galamkar prodayet odejdu kotoruyu sama shyet. Ona portnixa s 27 letnim stajem. Ey 47, Galamkar zamujem I u nee troe detey vozrastov ot 24 do 28.  Ona obratilas za kreditom v 1600 AZN dla togo chtobi kupit shveynie materiali I tkani.
texts.en: Galamkar sells clothing that she makes herself.  She's a seamstress with 27 years of experience in the business. She's 47 years old, married and has three kids aged from 24 to 28. She's applied for a loan of 1,600 AZN to purchase sewing materials and tissue.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials and tissue.

loans.name: George Milla

texts.en:
George is a 30-year-old  businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has two children, age 3 and 6. One of them goes to school.

George runs a phone repair shop and has been in business for five years. He has no employees. His major challenges include high transportation costs. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

He heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. He is taking a loan of 1,000 SDG to purchase phone covers and many other items.
  
In five years, George would like to expand his business and open other branches.

George says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy phone covers and many other items.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area located in the the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Sary is 55 years old. He is married and has five children, a few of whom are dependent on him and still in school while the others have their own employment. 

To support the family, Sary is a teacher in a local area while his wife plants bitter gourds and beans for sale to gain more income. Having been in this business for several years, they can earn about US $5 per day and manage to save about US $3 each day for the future.

Sary has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle. He completely paid back the first loan, which has helped him relieve his family’s burden and save some money for supporting his children’s education. 

Now he is applying for a loan with VisionFund of US $1,200. With this loan, he is going to buy fertilizer for his farmland and use a portion of it to support his children’s education. He hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to make a better living and keep his children in school until they finish their education.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farmland.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en:
Thorn is a 62-year-old married woman who resides in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has five children. One daughter is dependent on her and still in school. 

She and her husband have been in rice farming on one hectare of farmland for 15 years to make a living. They supplement the family’s income by buying and selling pigs in the local area. The current business earns them about KHR 22,000 per day and they manage to save 16,000 KHR each day for the future. Lack of capital is the main challenge for them to better support a business. 

Thorn is in her third loan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She successfully repaid the past loans, which have enabled her have enough capital to support the current business and improve their livelihood. 

Now she is requesting a loan with VisionFund of US $1,010. She is going to use this loan to buy some materials to construct a decent house for living in and use a portion of it to sustain her current business. With this loan, Thorn hopes to have a decent house for living in and also hopes to earn more income from the current business to improve her living conditions and also keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: To buy some materials to construct a decent house.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un señor de 60 años de edad , él  vive solo, es vecino de la comunidad de Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal,  ubicada en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus lindas  playas, su diversidad de vida silvestre y otras atracciones naturales.  Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.
Manuel trabaja dando mantenimiento a varios jardines de la localidad, su vivienda está en mal estado,  y debido a que estamos en época de lluvia necesita urgentemente reparar el techo de su casa y algunas paredes ya que el agua se le filtra y le causa grandes problemas.
Manuel  necesita un crédito  de seiscientos mil colones (¢600.000) para comprar madera, zinc y otros materiales para reparar su vivienda,  cuenta con el  apoyo de sus vecinos  quienes le ayudarán en los trabajos de reparación.

El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo  espera resolver este problema y vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 60 year old man.  He lives alone in the Osa community in Caña Blancal, which is in the Puntarenas province.  This community is noted for being a rural area that is visited a lot for its beautiful beaches, its diverse wildlife, and other natural attractions.  Its primary business activities are tourism and farming.

Manuel works providing maintenance to various gardens in the area.  His house is in a bad state, and because we are in the rainy season, he urgently needs to repair the roof of his house.  He also needs to repair some walls because the water leaks and causes big problems.

Manuel needs a loan for 600,000 colones to buy wood, zinc, and other materials for the repair work.

He is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, one of the 150 member organization of EDESA in Costa Rica.  With the loan he hopes to resolve this problem and live better.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Isabele Chantal

texts.fr: Chantal est une jeune femme de 37 ans fiancée, mère d'enfants. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 15 ans ou elle commercialise les vivres frais (tomates, poivrons, et piment...) en fonction des saisons.
