She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy pants, polo shirts, and sweaters to sell

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
Mario tiene 52 años, es casado y vive con su familia en Cayalti, distrito ubicado a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
Mario se dedica a la mecánica desde hace ya 12 años, tiempo que le ha permitido obtener mucha experiencia, la misma que ha sido enseñada a su hijo de 22 años.  Ambos, Mario y su hijo, se apoyan mutuamente en el negocio.
Mario anhela crecer, y en ese afán de lograrlo, ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá comprar insumos y repuestos como soldadura, fierro, pegamentos, etc. Y con ello podrá atender a más clientes y obtener más ingresos con lo que mejorará su nivel de vida.
Mario cuenta con historial crediticio en Edpyme Alternativa, teniendo a la fecha 2 créditos pagados puntualmente.
texts.en:
Mario is 52 years old. He is married, and lives with his family in Cayalti, a district located 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque department. 

Mario has been an auto mechanic for 12 years now, which has allowed him to gain a great deal of experience. He has taught his occupation to his 22-year-old son. Both of them, Mario and his son, support one another in the business.

Mario really wants his business to grow. In the desire to achieve it, he has seen fit to obtain a loan of 1000 nuevos soles; money that will allow him to buy supplies and spare parts, such as solder, steel, glues, etc. This way he will be able to serve more customers and earn more income. With this, he will improve his standard of living. 

Mario has a credit history with Edpyme Alternativa; to date having had two loans paid on time.

loans.use: To by material such as solder, steel, glues etc.

loans.name: Jose Marcelino

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo, ya que quiere continuar manteniendo la producción en el negocio y poder mantener un trabajo permanente, se comprará harina, azúcar, levadura, huevos, entre otros materiales que son necesarios para la producción de pan, esto le servirá ya que el cuenta con un número de clientes a quienes debe atender diariamente.

Con el préstamo anterior logró obtener buenos resultados, pues su trabajo ha tenido aceptación en los clientes, sus ventas han sido mejores y sus ingresos han cubierto aquellos gastos que son necesarios cubrir en el hogar.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan since he wants to continue the production in his business and to keep a regular job.  He will buy flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, and other supplies that he needs to bake bread.  This will help since he has a number of customers he serves every day.

The last loan gave him good results since his work has been favored by his customers.  His sales have been better and his investment has covered his household expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast and eggs

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en: Nieves, 58 years old, is widowed and has 2 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past year, Nieves has operated a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts for her business. In the future, Nieves would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanuts for her business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines for 20 years. She earns additional income from selling gasoline and raising livestock. Analiza is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling round timber in the Philippines.   She has been in this business for 15 years. Helen also earns more income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and renting boarding houses.

Helen is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of round timber to sell in her business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of round timber to sell.

loans.name: Gpf Ndiobene Bangadji Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Gpf ndiobene bangadji" est un groupe de solidarité qui compte 18 membres toutes des femmes.Elles exploitent un champs collectif de mil dans leur localité.La vente de la production leur rapporte des revenus qui leur permettent de subvenir à leurs besoins et à ceux de leurs familles notamment leurs enfants.Le chef de groupe( au milieu, en foulard rouge) est mère d'une famille de cinq enfants dont les deux vont à l'école.Elle vend durant la saison des pluies des fruits et durant la saison sèche des produits agricoles. Le groupement sollicite un pret de 990 000f pour acheter des semences et des engrais.
texts.en:
The group "Gpf ndiobene bangadji" is a unified group made up entirely of women. Together they farm a communal field of millet in their region. The profit they earn from selling their crop allows the women to support both their own basic needs and those of their families, most notably their children.

The captain of the group (in the middle, wearing a red head kerchief) is the mother of a family of five children, two of whom attend school. She sells fruits during the rainy season and agricultural products during the dry season. The group is requesting a loan of 990,000 francs CFA to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 47 years old and married with one child.   Victoria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running the store for 2 years.  

Victoria requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.  She has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan.  Victoria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her general store

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Amalia works hard to support her family.  She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.  She also earns additional income from raising pigs and goats. 

Amalia is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of bananas to sell in her business.  Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: buy bananas to resell

loans.name: Laine

texts.en:
Laine is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Laine has a small store that sells spices. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of spices to resell.

Laine is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy spices to resell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria, 54 years old, is married and has 8 children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 5 years, Maria has operated a charcoal retail business in the Philippines. She also earns an income from raising pigs. Maria has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more charcoal to sell.

Maria has previously borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of seven children, Haydee works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from renting beach cottages and raising chickens. Haydee is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Haydee has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 40 years old and married with 9 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Teresita has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from vegetables vending.

Teresita is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 42 years old and married with 6 children.    Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines.  She has been running her charcoal business for 20 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and farming rice.

Elena requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.   Elena has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy charcoal to resell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family.   She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 2 years now.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.   In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 30 years old, married and has five children who are in school. To earn a living, she does tailoring.  She works in a competitive environment with loyal customers. She has engaged herself in this business for ten years and has employed three people.  In addition, she sells fish to generate more income. 

Ruth's dream is to open more tailoring outlets in a different location in the future. She has requested for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fabrics.

loans.use: buy fabrics for her tailoring business

loans.name: Shela

texts.en: Shela is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 2 children. For the past 5 years, Shela has operated a shop where she makes and sells souvenirs. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy materials used in making souvenirs. Shela is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in making souvenirs

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita, 51 years old, is widowed and has 8 children. For the past 10 years, she has earned a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Angelita also earns additional income from making nipa (woven palm mats used for house construction and repair). She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Angelita works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic, 26 years old, is married and has one child who is in school. To earn a living, he sells fruits in a competitive environment with loyal customers. Dominic has engaged in this business for six years. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. Dominic dreams of expanding his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy fruits to sell.

loans.use: To buy fruits.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet, 25, is married and has three dependent children. She lives in a rental house in the town of Kaloleni. For the past 6 years, Linet has operated a retail business selling coconuts; she’s well-known in the zone and currently has a stable clientele. 

Linet is asking for a 20,000 KES loan to buy more coconuts for sale.  With this investment, she will be able to provide her children with a better quality of life and to move them forward. Linet very much wants to get ahead and to grow as a businesswoman. Her children are her reason to live and she strives for them daily. Nothing would make her happier than to see them become upstanding citizens. She gives thanks in advance for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Tuimizane Group

texts.fr: La cliente, Charlotte, conseillère du groupe de crédit Tuimizane, Femme joviale et dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est vendeuse des souliers au marché urbain de CADECO. Son mari est actuellement chômeur. Elle commença son business vers les années 2000 avec de fonds propres reçu de son mari. Elle fut initiée par ses pairs de lors qu’elle s’installa dans la ville de Goma. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation et scolarité pour ses enfants. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 8eme cycle de crédit. Au cours de la période, cette cliente a vu ses affaires prospèrent positivement. Grâce aux crédits de Hekima, elle a réalisé l’achat de la parcelle. Ainsi, elle a décidé d’augmenter son montant de crédit pour ce nouveau cycle. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 30 paires de souliers. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir en douceur. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu.
texts.en:
Charlotte is an advisor to the credit group Tuimizane; she is a jovial and dynamic woman, an entrepreneur, 33 years old, and mother of 7 children, all of whom attend school. Charlotte sells shoes at the urban market of Cadeco. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Charlotte began her business around the year 2000 with funds contributed by her husband. She was introduced to the business by her peers when she first moved to the city of Goma. The profits from Charlotte's business go to savings, food, and schooling for her children. 

This is Charlotte's 8th loan. Over the time she has been borrowing, Charlotte has seen her business thrive. Thanks to the loan from Hekima, she was able to purchase a plot of land. As a result, she has decided to raise her loan amount for this new loan. 

This new loan will allow Charlotte to purchase 30 pairs of shoes. Additionally, she hopes to see her children grow up enjoying a peaceful childhood. Charlotte thanks Hekima for their efforts bringing self-sufficiency to poor women with meager income.

loans.use: to purchase 30 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El socio Julio Cesar se dedica al negocio de distribucion de medicamentos y perfumeria,el socio lleva a diferentes farmacias,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio quiere salir adelante,el sueño del socio es tenre una farmacia.El socio solicita el credito para comprar medicamentos y perfumes.

El socio esta feliz con su prestamo y se compromete a cumplira con los pagos.
texts.en:
Member Julio Cesar is a medication and perfume distributor. He sells to different pharmacies and works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. He hopes to succeed through this business and his dream is to own his own pharmacy. He is requesting the loan to buy more medications and perfumes.

He is happy with his loan and he commits to pay it back.

loans.use: buy more medications and perfumes.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her bakery business.

Myrna has been in this business for two years. Myrna earns additional income from running her sari-sari store, farming rice, and selling cosmetics.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Nurys

texts.en:
Nurys is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to us because she needs to reinvest in her business. This is her third loan and she is very excited to be part of Esperanza. In her community there are some groups with loans and all the members are very happy and increasing their business. 

Nurys sells shoes, cosmetics, clothing, and jewelry. She is running a small store, where she sells all these products and other goods. She will use this loan to reinvest in her business and increase her inventory. Nurys said her most important challenge is to save enough money to provide for her family and to improve her business. She enjoys doing business. 

Nurys will use her business profits to reinvest and save. Nurys thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes, accessories, and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Feiruz

texts.en: Feiruz is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, blouses, trousers, handbags, and shoes to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan. She hopes to succeed and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is married with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nancy is 43 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Nancy has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Nancy has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her business

loans.name: Nobelinda

texts.en:
Nobelinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable and spice vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell for her vegetable and spice vending business.

Nobelinda has been in this business for 3 years. Nobelinda earns additional income from food vending.

Nobelinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to sell

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tejidos,la socia teje chompas,chalinas y pantalones,la socia vende en forma independiente llevando a las diferentes personas,la socia tambien sigue trabajando como docente del nivel inicial,el sueño de la socian es tener un local donde pueda vender los tejidos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar lanas y palitos de tejer al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to make a living from knitting, she knits sweaters, scarves and trousers. The member sells her products independently taking them to the clients. 

The member also continues to work as a teacher of the initial level, the dream of the member is to have a small store where she can sell her products.The partner asks for the loan to buy wool and knitting needles. The partner is happy with the loan and is committed to pay punctually the payments.

loans.use: to buy wool and knitting needles.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 34 years old and married with one child. He runs a boda boda (motorcycle) transport business to earn a living. He has engaged in this business for four years. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save and manage his business through the training he attended. He dreams of owning five motorbikes in the future. Michael is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to service his motorbike.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 63 años, está casada con Alejandro, con quien tiene seis hijos. Viven en la casa propia que Alejandro construyó de joven.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde los 20 años, es decir, desde que se casó. Cuenta con parcelas propias que la comunidad le otorgó donde cultiva café, plátano, cacao, yuca, maíz y naranjas. “Me gusta cultivar de todo, así ya no me preocupo mucho en el dinero porque tengo para mis gastos”, menciona orgullosa. Actualmente está limpiando sus cultivos de la mala yerba, pero no será suficiente para culminar como había planeado, por eso contratará personal. 

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y agradece la confianza que ponen en ella, por lo que promete pagar las cuotas en las fechas indicadas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Unión Orito”, donde también promete participar de las reuniones.
Este dinero lo invertirá en el pago del personal operario que contratará para la limpieza de su cafetal.
texts.en:
Dominga is 63 years old. She is married to Alejandro, with whom she has six children. They live in their own home which Alejandro built as a young man. 

She has been a farmer for 20 years, that is, since she married. She says that with her own parcels of land that the community granted her, she grows coffee, plantains, cacao, yucca, corn and oranges. “I like to grow everything, that way I don't have to worry much about money because I have enough for my expenses," she says proudly. Right now, she is clearing her crops of weeds, but it won't be enough to finish every thing she has to do, so she will hire laborers. 

This is her first loan with MFP and she is grateful for the trust that has been put in her. That is why she promises to make her payments on time. She belongs to the “Unión Orito” communal bank, where she also promises to attend the meetings. She will invest the money in paying for the laborers she will hire to clear her coffee field.

loans.use: to pay for the laborers she will hire to clear her coffee field.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto tiene 52 años, vive solo, pues se separó de su pareja. 
Hace más de 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, tiempo suficiente para adquirir 14 parcelas de terrenos, pero ahora solo produce en ocho de ellas. Sus principales cultivos son: café, cacao, achiote, naranja y plátano. En las parcelas que no cultiva ahora piensa sembrar kión, para ello ya tiene fertilizantes orgánicos esperando el momento. Mientras tanto va cosechando naranjas y plátanos, de esta manera puede cubrir sus principales gastos. Ahora tiene que iniciar con el mantenimiento de los otros cultivos, que ya tienen mucha maleza interrumpiendo el crecimiento.

Este es su préstamo número 5 con MPF y agradece el apoyo brindado anteriormente, por eso dice que pagará las cuotas con puntualidad. Le agradan las labores con su banco comunal, porque el sistema de trabajo es en equipo.
Roberto invertirá el dinero en el pago de tres personas que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Roberto is 52 years old. He lives alone, since he is separated from his partner. He has worked in agriculture for more than 30 years, sufficient time to acquire 14 parcels of land, but now he only produces on 8 of them. His principal crops are coffee, cacao, achiote, oranges, and bananas. In the parcels that he doesn't cultivate now, he is thinking of planting ginger. He already has organic fertilizers for that, waiting for the right time. Meanwhile he is harvesting oranges and bananas. In this way he can cover his principal expenses. Now he has to begin the maintenance of the other fields, which already have many weeds interfering with growth.

This is his fifth loan with MPF, and he is grateful for the support offered in the past. For this reason, he says that he will make his payments punctually. He is pleased with the work of his communal bank, because the system for working is in a team.

Roberto will invest the money in paying three people whom he will hire to clean his fields.

loans.use: to pay three people whom he will hire to clean his fields

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 34 years old and has 3 children. Wilma is married, and all of her children are in school.

Wilma is in the agricultural business and farms rice in the Philippines. Wilma requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Wilma has been farming rice for 8 years now, and she has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Wilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es: Osvaldo, tiene la edad  de 34 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer algunos trabajos que mejoren las condiciones y hacer la compra de algunas plantas de café para mejorar la densidad de plantas por área, también la compra de fertilizantes y algunos fungicidas y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Además de poder comprar los mejores materiales y hacer los trabajos lo más pronto posible y aplicar los fertilizantes  a tiempo para que la cosecha sea de buena calidad y abundante y hacer esto antes de que se madure la misma, con los ingresos que pueda obtener pretende invertir más y cumplir algunas metas familiares. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Osvaldo is 34 years old and married. He lives with his wife and children who are his biggest priority. With his loan, he intends on doing some work to improve conditions and buy some coffee plants to improve the area density of plants. He will also buy fertilizer and some fungicides to ensure good work. He will be able to buy the best materials and do the work as soon as possible and apply the fertilizer on time so the harvest will be of good quality and abundant. He needs to do this before the crop matures. With the income he can get, he intends on investing more and meeting some family goals. This is his first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had any loans from government banks, but FUDECOSUR  has offered him the loan with easy terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: Asistencia de café

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 34 years old and married with 2 children.

Rosalie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Rosalie has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for a year and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and rice.

Rosalie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Liana Nohemi

texts.es:
Liana, habitante de Yali una comunidad en las afueras de Estelí  madre de un hijo de 3 años de edad, actualmente soltera, con pocos conocimientos académico. Se dedica a vender tortillas negocio que inicio con dinero propio hace 2 años sin ningún tipo de apoyo ya que anteriormente laboraba en limpieza , con escasos recursos económicos ha logrado salir adelante junto a su hijo .
Ha solicitado préstamo Kiva para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento ,arena y ladrillo para componer su fogón (cocina de leña) que en donde elabora las tortillas y también comprar maíz, negocio que considera muy bueno por que obtiene ganancias a diario. De esta manera ha podido mantener a su hijo hasta hoy, su principal sueño es comprar su propia casa y así vivir cómodamente  atravez del préstamo pretende mantener siempre estable su negocio y futuramente abrir una pulpería para obtener mayores ingresos y sentirse estable económicamente.
texts.en: Liana lives in Yali, a community on the outskirts of Esteli; she is mother to a 3 year old child, single, and with limited educational background.  She now sells tortillas, a business she started with her own money and no support about 2 years ago, prior to that she used to do janitorial work.  With limited resources, she's been able to get ahead along with her child.  She has solicited a Kiva loan to purchase construction materials, such as: cement, sand, and bricks to build a hearth (wood burning stove) where she will make tortillas; she will also be purchasing corn.  She considers selling tortillas a good business because she has daily earnings and has been able to support her son to this day through these means.  Her dream is to buy a home and live comfortably.  Through the loan, she intends on keeping a stable business and in the future opening a convenience store in order to have better income and feel financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a wood burning stove, such as: cement, sand, and brick, and ingredients such as corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Donald

texts.es: Donald, tiene la edad  de 42 años, está casado,  vive con sus hijos y esposa, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una vaca para la producción de leche, para mantener al animal cuenta con un terreno de pasto, el cual  cuenta con buenas condiciones para mantener a la vaca. La propiedad cuenta con agua potable para suministrarle al animal         . Lo que quiere es poder asegurarse de comprar una vaca saludable y que tengan una buena producción de leche y de una calidad adecuada. Es el primer  préstamo que he recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Donald is 42 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and children, who are his biggest priority. With this loan, he intends on buying a dairy cow to produce milk. To support the animal he has pasture land in good condition to support a cow. The property has potable water to provide the animal with. What he wants is to ensure the purchase of a healthy cow with good milk production and adequate quality. This is his first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He hasn't had other loans from government banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with good conditions and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ademar

texts.es: Ademar, tiene la edad  de 34 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizante, herramientas y algunas plantas de café para mejorar la densidad de plantas por área y pagar mano de obra para los trabajos realizados, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Además de poder comprar los mejores materiales y hacer los trabajos lo más pronto posible y aplicar los fertilizantes  a tiempo para que la cosecha sea de buena calidad y abundante y hacer esto antes de que se madure la misma. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ademar, 34, is married and lives with his children and his wife, who are his first priority. With this loan, he will purchase fertlizer, nutrients and some coffee plants to improve the density of plants on his land, and pay for laborers to carry out the work. By doing this he will be able to ensure that a good job is done. He will also be able to purchase better materials, carry out work quickly, fertlize the plants in good time to ensure a an abundant and good quality harvest, and do this before they have matured.

This is the first loan that Ademar has received from FUDECOSUR. He has never previously taken a loan from state banks, however FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better conditions and much lower levels of interest.

loans.use: to grow and care for coffee plants

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 56 years old, is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Milagros has had a food business in the Philippines for the past 18 years. 

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Helman

texts.es: Helman, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende comprar fertilizantes y hacer algunas labores culturales que a mediano y largo plazo se mejore las condiciones del cultivo, también la compra de fertilizantes y algunos fungicidas y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Además de poder comprar los mejores materiales y hacer los trabajos lo más pronto posible y aplicar los fertilizantes  a tiempo para que la cosecha sea de buena calidad y abundante y hacer esto antes de que se madure la misma, con los ingresos que pueda obtener pretende invertir más y cumplir algunas metas familiares. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Helman is 44 years old. He is married, and he lives with his children and his wife, who are his greatest priority. With his loan he intends to buy fertilizers and do some work that in the medium and longer term will improve the conditions of his land, as well as purchasing fertilizers and some fungicides, and in this way be assured of doing a good job. In addition he will be able to buy the best materials, do the work as soon as possible, and apply the fertilizers on time so that the harvest will be of good quality and abundant, and he will be able to do this before the crops mature. With the income that he can obtain, he intends to invest more and complete some family goals. This is the first loan that he will receive from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans from state banks, but Fudecosur has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and improve his land

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a 42-year-old man who lives in the town of Kaloleni together with his family: his wife, Saumu, and their five children who attend a local school. Benard operates a vegetable stall, selling a variety of fruits and vegetables. He sells to the neighborhood and has established a good customer base: thanks to his efforts, he has been able to send his children to school.

Due to financial shortages, he decided to visit Yehu offices to seek financial support after being introduced by a friend. Benard is asking for a loan of Ksh 30,000 to purchase more fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, bananas, cabbages and other varieties. He hopes to repay his loan on time so he can request more loans.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables such as tomatoes, bananas, cabbages and other varieties.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 33 years old and is married with two children who are both in school. To earn a living, Joseph runs a motorcycle transport business in a competitive environment with reliable customers. He has been in this business for four years. Through Faulu Kenya's financial management training, he has improved his saving skills. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. Joseph is requesting for a loan of 30,000 KES to service his motorcycle.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 40 years old and is married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store (a sari-sari store) in the Philippines for the past two years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Analiza has now requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her grocery store. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15500 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

NWTF is relisting Luciana's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Ernalein

texts.en:
Ernalein is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Ernalein has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for four years. 

Ernalein has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Ernalein hopes to improve her business so she can support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Nely has a food/retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. 

Nely has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Nely hopes to improve her business to provide for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stock including canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Ndondy

texts.fr: Mme Ndondy habite à quelque pas de l’agence, mariée et mère de famille elle s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle  a aménagé une table devant chez elle pour vendre des poissons et des lègumes, son petit commerce lui permet de soutenir son mari pour les besoins quotidiens de la famille. Elle  sollicite un prêt de 200 000 f pour acheter un réfrigérateur afin d’être plus productive et avoir plus de bénéfices. Avec ce prêt elle pourra épargner et aider son mari pour les dépenses familiales, Mme Ndondy rêve un jour d’avoir un grand dépôt de poissons et vendre en gros.
texts.en:
Mme Ndondy lives a few steps from the branch office. She is a married mother active in commerce for over five years. She has fixed up a table in front of her home to sell fish and vegetables. Her small business enables her to support her husband in meeting day-to-day family needs. 

She is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to purchase a refrigerator to be more productive and to make more profit. With this loan, she will be able to save money and help her husband with family expenses. Ms. Ndondy dreams one day of having a large warehouse for fish and to sell in bulk.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to keep fish and vegetables, which she sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlyn is 50 years old. All of her children are in school.

Marlyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fish to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Ndoumbé

texts.fr:
Mme Ndoumbé mariée et mère de famille habite à environ 1 km de l’Institution, elle évolue dans le commerce depuis quelques années en vendant des tissus et des jus qu’elle achète dans une ville située à 70 km de chez elle. 
Mme Ndoumbé sollicite un prêt de 200 000 f pour acheter 10 grosses de jus de 24 paquets à 20 000 f l’unité pour pouvoir réaliser plus de bénéfices, de ce fait elle pourra mieux s’occuper de ses enfants et épargner pour élargir après son petit commerce. Mme Ndoumbé ne rêve que d’une chose devenir grossiste et avoir une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Ms. Ndoumbé is a married mother living about 1 km from this microfinance institution. She has been working in commerce for a few years selling cloth and juices that she purchases from a city located 70 km from her home. 

Ms. Ndoumbé is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to purchase 10 grosses of juice at 24 packets each for 20,000 francs a unit in order to make more profit. Thus, she will be able to take better care of her children and to save money to expand her small business. Ms. Ndoumbé dreams of only one thing: to become a wholesale merchant having financial autonomy.

loans.use: to purchase juices to resell

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Milagros works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Milagros is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets for her business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 37 years old and married with 2 children.

Lorena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell.

Lorena has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and also earns an income from retail of rice.

Lorena aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Niño Jesús esta conformado por mujeres que tienen distintas actividades, algunas se dedican a la venta de productos otras son ama de casa pero, sí, son todas responsables y cumplen los plazos.
La Sra. Eugenia, presidenta del grupo, es una mujer muy emprendedora e innovadora, realiza sus ventas de forma ambulante a crédito como también al contado. Se dedica especialmente a la venta de ropas para mujeres que con alegría y buenos precios obtiene una venta que aporta a la economía familiar y que sirve muchas veces para cubrir los gastos. 
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar ropas como. camisas, remeras, jeans, polleras, etc. que pueda ofrecer a su clientela y pueda gustar.
texts.en:
The communal bank Divino Niño Jesús (Divine Baby Jesus) is formed by women who have different business activities. Some work in selling products, others are housewives, but yes, all are responsible and make their payments.

Señora Eugenia, the president of the group, is a very entrepreneurial and innovative woman. She makes sales as a walking vendor, both on credit and also for cash. She especially sells clothing for women, from whom, with happiness and good prices, she obtains sales that support her family economy and many times serve to cover her expenses.

She is applying for the loan to buy clothing such as shirts, T-shirts, jeans, skirts, etc., which she can offer to her customers and which they will like.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as T-shirts, shirts, and pants to sell

loans.name: Ma. Clarita

texts.en:
Ma. Clarita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

NWTF is relisting Ma. Clarita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz tiene 27 años, es una mujer emprendedora, muy trabajadora y con deseos de superación. Su pareja es Segundo, con quien tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años. Vive junto a toda su familia en su humilde casa, la que construyó en base a mucho esfuerzo y constancia.

Su actividad es la venta de “aguaje”, este es un fruto de una palmera tropical que se consume ampliamente en toda la región amazónica de Perú. Liz vende esta fruta todos los días en una carretilla y se traslada por las calles principales de la ciudad en busca de clientes que quieran degustar este exquisito manjar selvático. Lleva en este negocio más de 3 años y siempre ha trabajado sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja al finalizar el día. La necesidad de cubrir las carencias económicas en su casa la llevaron a desarrollar este trabajo y algunas veces le resulta muy agotador. Sin embargo, espera continuar con su negocio, ya que es su única fuente de ingreso.

Este es su primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su financiamiento para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas que responsables y muy solidarias entre sí. 
Con el monto solicitado, 300 soles, comprará cuatro sacos de aguaje para continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lis is a hard-working 27 year-old entrepreneur with many wishes of success.  Her husband is Segundo with whom she has two children of 8 and 4 years of age.  She lives near her entire family in her humble home which was built from the ground up with a lot of hard work and determination. 

She makes a living selling aguaje, a fruit from a tropical palm tree that is widely consumed in the amazon region of Peru.  Everyday, Liz sells this fruit from her cart as she travels through the main roads of the city in search of customers who would like to taste this jungle delicacy.  She has been running this business for over three years and has always worked alone.  She considers her business as quite profitable due to the money she makes at the end of the day.  The necessity to cover home expenses drove her to develop this business and although sometimes it is exhausting she hopes to continue her business as it is her only source of income.     

This is her first loan with MFP Institution.  She thanks everyone who makes the financing of her business possible as it allows her to solidify her plans.  In addition, she is grateful for the people of her communal bank because all its members are responsible and very independent.  With this loan, 300 Sols, she will purchase four bags of aguaje to continue her sales.

loans.use: to purchase four bags of aguaje to continue her sales.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, who is widowed, works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Lolita has requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en: Zakaria is 31 years old and married with one child who is in school. To earn a living, he operates a barber shop and a salon in the same premise. He has been engaged in this business for five years and has employed two people.  In addition, Zakaria sells clothes to generate more income. He dreams of operating more outlets in a different location in the future. With the loan of 60,000 KES, Zakaria will buy a shaving machine, a blow dryer and hair oil.

loans.use: To buy a shaving machine, blow dryer and hair oil

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en: Marvie is married and has two children. Marvie is 39 years old, and resides in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Marvie owns and operates a farm, planting & harvesting bananas to sell to earn a living and she's been in this business for eight years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. In 2011, Marvie joined GDMPC. In the future, Marvie wants to make improvements to her house and improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 32 years old and married with three children.

Mary Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Mary Grace has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for a year and earns additional income from selling school supplies and gasoline.

Mary Grace aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anania

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Anania works hard to support her family. She has a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming root crops. 

Anania has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. Anania hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Macile

texts.en:
Macile is 29 years old and married with one child.

Macile works hard to provide for her family. He runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Macile has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Macile aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 49 years old and married with 4 children. With 2 children in school, Antonia works very hard to provide for her family.

Antonia runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more inventory.

Antonia has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, snack foods, and other grocery items. 

In the future Antonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is married and works hard to support her family. She has had a trisikad (pedicab) transport business in the Philippines for the past three years and earns additional income from fish vending.

Jasmin has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad (pedicab) for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad (pedicab) for her business.
